campaign.story:
Staying late in their office, a motley crew of clickbait writers are watching the top thirteen scariest viral videos in preparation for a Halloween listicle, but when an early entry curses whoever watches the cryptic link, our snarky hipsters must distinguish fact from fiction before a tidal wave of terrifying supernatural activity leads to real-life murders.
Winner of “Best Horror Comedy” and nominated for “Best Writing” at the 2020 Nightmares Film Festival: Masquerade where the film premiered virtually last October.
MORE GORY DETAILS
What Happens Next Will Scare You includes a wrap around story and eight spooky anthology segments.
Paul Fahrenkopf as Rooster
Helenmary Ball and Brian St. August return as Paranormal Experts, Dr. Louis & Claire Berger
Each viral video segment features its own monster from the darkest recesses of the internet.
Mike C. Walls as Mr. Tickles
Craig Peter Coletta as Father Demetri Barrett in “How To Perform An Exorcism”
ABOUT THE CREATORS
Midnight Crew Studios has produced seven award winning, critically acclaimed feature length horror films. Our films have been praised by the New York Times, VICE, NPR, and MTV.
Our Lovecraft comedy, Call Girl of Cthulhu brought unfathomable horrors to the international film fest circuit.
PLAY

Our found footage film, WNUF Halloween Special is currently streaming on Shudder.
PLAY

For a behind the scenes look at our previous horror filmmaking adventures…
LIGHTS! TENTACLES! ACTION! The Making of "Call Girl of Cthulhu"
PLAY

BLOOD, SWEAT, & BEERS: The Making of "Witch's Brew"
PLAY

DIRECTED BY SHUDDER LABS FELLOW, CHRIS LAMARTINA
Hosted by Shudder, AMC Networks’ horror streaming platform, Shudder Labs is a creative workshop retreat dedicated to building the skill set and talents of exciting, emerging horror filmmakers.
In 2016, Writer/Director/Producer Chris LaMartina was selected as one of the eleven inaugural Shudder Labs fellows.
PLAY

During the five-day workshop, What Happens Next Will Scare You was further developed under the guidance of Shudder’s Masters-in-Residence mentors.
WHY PLEDGE NOW?
What Happens Next Will Scare You is completed and will be released digitally in the fall of 2021.
For every feature we’ve produced thus far, we’ve gone with traditional distribution channels, but as the market changes, we decided to give self-distribution a shot for this film. You can rest easy knowing that every single dollar raised will go back to the filmmakers responsible for the flick you’re watching. With your help, we’ll pay for the dvd printing costs, and maybe even most of the budget.
FEATURED REWARDS
In exchange for your pledge, you’ll get digital and/or physical copies of the film.
What Happens Next Will Scare You DVDs will include:
The Feature Film
Audio Commentary
Unreleased Anthology Segments with Commentaries
REVIEWS
Rue Morgue
Morbidly Beautiful
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
We’ve been able to make movies because of the support from our community. We’re so grateful for the generosity we’ve been gifted over the years.
Thank you for continuing to help us bring our stories to life!

campaign.story:
GHOSTS is a full motion video, horror game stepping into the shoes of Night Trap, Phantasmagoria and The 7th Guest. It’s a real-time live action game which means that it has to be played at 10pm in your local time zone. Written and Directed by Jed Shepherd (writer and exec producer of HOST - “The Scariest Movie of the last Decade” - Dread Central & “The Genre Phenomenon of 2020” - Forbes) in partnership with Visible Games & Limited Run Games. The game takes inspiration from the works of Manx screenwriter Nigel Kneale and the blurring of fact and fiction in the found footage movies from the last 25 years. However, unlike previous games in this oft-forgotten genre we’re creating a horror experience that aims to truly chill your blood and send full motion video games screaming into the modern day.
Starring Emma Louise Webb, Haley Bishop, Jemma Moore, Radina Drandova and Caroline Ward, GHOSTS features terrifying creature design by Trevor Henderson (SirenHead).
Hey, I’m Jed and I’m making a video game called GHOSTS.
Last Halloween, frustrated by the neverending lockdown situation in the UK, like a lot of people I turned to video games for escapism. Looking specifically for horror games to freak me out, I re-discovered the live-action video games (FMV) of the 90s. Titles like Night Trap, Phantasmagoria and Double Switch (featuring the utterly superb Corey Haim), games that dared to try something a bit different and really pushed the capabilities of the game systems of their time.
It suddenly dawned on me what I had to do - I had to make a live action video game starring my friends Emma, Haley, Jemma, Radina and Caroline and make it as scary as hell. I want to make you afraid of even looking at your Nintendo Switch but feel absolutely compelled to play the game anyway to help the ladies survive.
I contacted Visible Games to see if they were into helping me make it and posited the question: What if it was LIVE?
What if it's hard-coded into the narrative of the game that you have to play it at a certain time? What if everyone in your time zone is playing the game at exactly that moment? It would make it an unprecedented terrifying event.  Wouldn’t that be cool?  Luckily Visible Games have the unique skills to pull this concept off and make this unique feature a reality.
We took the idea to Limited Run Games and I’ve never heard a faster YES in my life. Their support has been legendary and their reputation of delivering superior games is second to none. They will be releasing the game on all formats early next year.
Building the team to help make this has been so much fun and I went to the absolute best to visualise the ‘antagonist’, THE LONG LADY. Designed by SIRENHEAD creator Trevor Henderson, I’ve genuinely got the best people on the GHOSTS train!
You’re probably thinking “Jed, why don’t you just make a movie? Why a live-action video game?”. My answer is: Why Not?
So as not to reveal too many spoilers, we have to be a little careful about the information you receive this early on. What we can say is ...
You play a TV producer, operating the outside broadcast van for a failing cable channel called FrighTV. Their flagship show is GHOSTS. It’s the only thing people want to watch on the channel anymore. A show that in its heyday captured millions of viewers on a major channel. Viewers were glued to their screens as the presenter with a team of eager ghost hunters explored haunted locations around the country.
Over the years, GHOSTS ratings began to drop which ultimately resulted in the show being dropped by the network and languishing on various freeview channels until it was purchased by FrighTV and re-branded for re-launch in 2022. The channel is littered with terrible adverts and trailers for movies you’ve never heard of and never want to watch.
As the cast explore the location, you not only need to worry about their safety, the noises you hear around the van and the strange neighbours, there’s also the urban legend of THE LONG LADY. Sightings of THE LONG LADY on this very street have chilled the bones of residents for decades. She appears in times of tragedy, looking through the windows of houses on the street. It’s said that if you look directly at her face, you die. Curtain salesmen do gangbusters here.
Evidence submitted via a recovered mobile phone
Above is photograph 2 of 3 taken from the discard mobile phone.
Photograph 3 of 3
You are the outside broadcast producer, in charge of what is shown to the viewers at home who have remained loyal to the show throughout all the lean years. The show is LIVE so you have to think on your feet and react to every moment to keep things interesting.  In front of you will be all of the camera feeds streaming from cameras installed in the most haunted location in London as well as heart rate monitors for the cast. What gets sent to the LIVE feed is your choice and can affect the future of the show (and perhaps the safety of the cast). You need to keep the show entertaining and you will have various tricks to employ to help you ‘spice up’ the live show.
You also have various documents, videos and audio files, collected throughout the years from this local community that you need to decipher to help understand the grave situation. Perhaps something you discover will stop the horrifying events from unfolding.
The full terrifying real-time version of the game is only playable at 10pm in your local time zone. If you load up the game before 10pm you’ll be met with a classic test card. If you can crack the ‘test’ you will have access to an unlockable pre-watershed version where you can breathe and save your progress, but once you hit 10pm all bets are off! There are consequences for all of your choices though. Playing it safe is not always the best option.
When playing GHOSTS, if you leave your station at any point, the game notices the lack of movement and it will end your session. Desertion of duty means the cast will be killed off. You are responsible for the lives of all involved so make sure you’ve had a bathroom break, got plenty of snacks and most importantly turn off the lights!

Haley Bishop is an American actress, based in London. She stars in BIFA nominated 'HOST' (2020) on AMC Networks' horror streaming service, SHUDDER. Other credits include Warner Brothers TOM AND JERRY (2021), ANGEL HAS FALLEN (2019), and DEEP STATE (2018).
She is also a writer and producer with SWR Media in both scripted and non scripted. Her most recent comedy, 1-800-D-Direct, premiered at the BFI in 2020 and is currently having a successful festival run, next playing at BAFTA qualifying Carmarthen Bay Film Festival.
Radina Drandova is a Bulgarian actress based in London. She graduated from the prestigious Royal Central School of Speech and Drama. Most recently starring in BIFA nominated, international cult hit sensation, ‘HOST’ (2020). Radina also stars in the short film ‘Dawn of the Deaf’ (2016) which appeared in over 100 film festivals worldwide, including Sundance. You can also catch Radina as the lead in the award winning short ‘PITFALL’ (2017) on Amazon Prime. Radina is part of an international community of artists championing truthful storytelling of the multicultural experience. She also loves pizza, sunshine and her favorite game is Unravel.
Jemma Moore stars in BIFA nominated 'HOST' which is currently 100% 'Certified Fresh' on Rotten Tomatoes and nominated as third best reviewed British film of 2020 in the Golden Tomato Awards. 'HOST' is also one of EMPIRE magazine's 'Best Movies of 2020' with Jemma's character making it into EMPIRE magazine's 'The 100 Best Horror Movie Characters' list. It was named one of TIME magazine's '17 Great Movies You may have Missed this Summer', Variety's 'Best Horror Movies of 2020' and Total Film's 'Best horror films of all time'. Jemma is also known for her roles in 'DOOM: ANNIHILATION' (2019), 'SHAKESPEARE & HATHAWAY' (2019) and 'WONDER WOMAN' (2018).
Caroline Ward is most recently known for her performance in BIFA Nominated, 'HOST'. 'HOST' is available on all major on-demand platforms, had an international cinema release in December 2020 and was released on Blu-Ray in February 2021. ‘HOST’ has been named in EMPIRE Magazine's ‘The Best Movies Of 2020’, TotalFilm’s ‘The 30 Best Horror Movies Of All Time’, Variety’s ‘Best Horror Movies of 2020’ and Certified 100% Fresh on Rotten tomatoes.
Caroline is also co-founder of It Girls Productions, a production company focusing on female-led narratives, representation and inclusivity. 2021 will see short films 'Stalling It' (It Girls Productions) and 'Third on the Left' (Blotched Ink Productions), both written and directed by Caroline, on the festival circuit.
Emma Louise Webb is an Actress of screen and stage, Musician, Commercial Model and Writer from South East London. She trained at Identity School of Acting.
Emma appeared in the TV show The Crown before moving onto features with MULTIPLEX (2020) and the horror sensation HOST (2020). Emma is featured in numerous commercials for the likes of McDonalds, Samsung and many more. Her new girl group will be launching some time in 2021.
Jed Shepherd is a screenwriter, producer and director from South London. A walking-talking encyclopedia of Horror but also still mortally afraid of the bog of Eternal Stench from Labyrinth. He is a Henson super fan and has multiple Horror films in development with Blumhouse, Sam Raimi and StudioCanal. He also finds time to consistently beat Emma at Mario Kart.
Visible Games are a UK and US based indie development studio filled to the brim with creative talent. Our team is made up of the best indie games makers we could possibly find, and one that is committed to every title we make. We also boast an in-house music production suite and love horror and gaming with every fibre of our being!  
Trevor Henderson is a writer and illustrator. His love of monsters, cryptids, ghosts and other horrible entities is enduring and vast. When he is not drawing or writing horrible things, he is thinking about the unknowable and hostile forces working against all of humanity, and playing with his cat, who is named Boo. He is available for local projects as well as potential employment opportunities.
Limited Run Games is a Raleigh-based publisher founded in 2015 that focuses on preserving games in a physical format. Publishing over 300 games in its lifetime and winning awards for its bespoke Collector’s Editions, Limited Run is the gold standard in bringing digital-only games to physical form for casual fans and collectors alike. Visit limitedrungames.com for the latest offerings, or follow the brand on your social media platform of choice for all LRG-related updates: @limitedrungames.
Graham Humphreys is an illustrator and designer with 40 years experience. One of the few contemporary illustrators using the traditional medium of gouache to paint his images, Graham is best known for his work within the horror genre. This site is both an online portfolio of work, but also a visual testament to the enduring appeal of horror through cinema and home entertainment.
We have teamed up with the legendary Limited Run Games to produce the physical items for GHOSTS. Their previous experience with fulfilment means that your physical Nintendo Switch or Playstation game will be shipped with all the care you’ve come to expect from them. It’s important to note that the exclusive Graham Humphreys artwork will only be available with these Kickstarter releases, so don’t miss out!

If you want a little bit more oomph to your GHOSTS experience we have also teamed up with the amazing FRIGHT RAGS to offer an exclusive t-shirt too as part of our pledge tiers! 
GHOSTS for Playstation with exclusive Fright Rags Tee 
GHOSTS for Nintendo Switch with exclusive Fright Rags T-Shirt 

The Collectors Edition of the game features a host of items that we can’t wait for you to get your hands on. Here’s a quick rundown of everything you get!
The GHOSTS Collectors Edition by Limited Run Games 
The GHOSTS Collectors Edition by Limited Run Games comes with ...
Physical Game for Nintendo Switch or Playstation
Digital Key for GHOSTS (Switch, Playstation, PC or Xbox)
Exclusive Graham Humphreys GHOSTS Cover
GHOSTS Logo Sew on Patch
Exclusive Limited Edition GHOSTS T-Shirt from Fright Rags!
GHOSTS Sticker Sheet
The Long Lady Acrylic Standee
VHS Collectors Edition GHOSTS Clamshell Case (to hold all the contents)
Documentary ‘The Making of GHOSTS’ on Blu-Ray
1 of 1 Polaroid taken by the Cast and Crew during the filming of GHOSTS
That’s right! The cast and crew of GHOSTS will be armed with Polaroid Cameras throughout the shoot and you will receive a one-off polaroid taken by them. It could be anything from their time behind the scenes or an exclusive to you look at how we achieved the special effects. One unfortunate person will get a cursed polaroid of the face of The Long Lady.
You asked and we delivered. Limited Edition GHOSTS Jumpsuits are now available as part of the higher tiers ... including personalized ones too! 
Now, this one is something special. Either we will include a photo of you in the game itself or you will work with Jed and Visible Games to have your voice featured in the actual game! Yes, you will be one of the callers during a phone-in segment of the show. This is LIVE remember. Perhaps you’ve seen the The Long Lady before, strange memories from your youth that you’ve blocked out until now. Maybe you’re experiencing supernatural manifestations and want to talk to someone about it.  Maybe you’re just low-life prank caller! You will be immortalised in this one of a kind game.
If you want to check what items you will receive in your pledge, we've created this handy matrix for you to check too.
Since Limited Run Games will not be shipping backers their physical copy until 2022. We have decided that shipping costs for physical items will be charged to backers after the campaign has concluded. 
Shipping will be charged after this Kickstarter finishes and this will be based on actual costs incurred to ship and is collected via our pledge manager system. This allows us to charge fairly for all backers and avoid a "one size fits all" mentality to shipping.
At present we have been advised that the shipping to the US and Canada should be around $5 whilst shipping to the RoW will be around $20.
We are working directly with Limited Run Games and will be using their fulfilment centers and partners to ensure that your order ships quickly and the DDP is included so that you can get your physical rewards without any extra hassles!
Because GHOSTS is 99% live action, production needs to begin before we can offer you screenshots or gameplay footage ... and even then we're going to be super careful that we don't want to spoil any of the surprises we have in store for you!
We have carefully calculated our budget so that we can afford the best of the best for this production. We have already heavily invested in creatures being fabricated by the Jim Henson Creature Shop and securing the services of our cast, stunt professionals and visual effects team.
We estimate that 55% of our Kickstarter funds will be put directly towards the production itself which is shaping up to be a huge affair. 35% of our funds will be used to produce the items that are being handled by the fantastic Limited Run Games.
This leaves around 10% which we will use as both a margin of error and for marketing purposes, but we hope you spread the word too!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
First and foremost we absolutely love horror and gaming! However, obviously at the moment we're fully aware and taking as many precautions as we can against Covid-19. All members of the team will be taking regular lateral flow tests supplied by the London Medical Laboratory in order to ensure a safe working environment.

We are also working alongside industry leading stunt coordinators Lucky 13 Action (https://lucky13action.com/) who will ensure that all stunts will be performed in accordance with all regulations.

After the shoot takes place then it's down to editing at the same time as finishing up the engine for the system. We will post updates frequently with regards to our progress. We truly believe GHOSTS will be one of these games to overcome the trying times and become a landmark moment in FMV gaming.

This motivation, above all others, is what drives us.

In terms of timing: we are targeting Feb 2022 for release. However, it does depend on our funding amount. The higher we go, the more hands we can bring "on deck" and get to work quicker. Ultimately, it is far more important to deliver a game that meets the expectations of our fans than to hit a date. We have already built a significant portion of the game, but we do have a lot of work to do.

We have carefully budgeted this project and believe that our funding goal is realistic to provide you with the experience you deserve. Thank you again for the opportunity to make this game happen!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: What an amazing 30 days this has been! Thank you from the bottom of our hearts, your pledges have made GHOSTS a reality! Work is already well underway on the project, and we will be updating everybody at least once a month going forward with what is happening behind the scenes and we can't wait to share the journey with you.

updates.update_userinfo: GHOSTS fully funded - The Long Lady Lives!
updates.update_content: "Thank you so much for believing in GHOSTS. When I came up with this idea it felt like a pipe dream, one of these fleeting moments of inspiration that disappeared as soon as it arrived. Luckily, when lots of people dream at the same time, you can make that idea a reality. You turn the intangible, tangible. Not only have you made this game a reality but collectively we have summoned The Long Lady. I really can’t wait for you to meet her. So for now, while we can, let’s celebrate! Once again, thank you thank you thank you!" -

"I just wanted to thank everyone for helping us reach the mighty 90% funded mark on kickstarter. It means a lot that you believe in it! This belief will help The Long Lady come to life, whether the world is ready or not! I'm hoping she never has to thank you in person one day..." Jed Shepherd, Writer / Director of GHOSTS

Happy Friday everyone, the response to the cover tease a few days ago was fantastic and we thought we'd make the leap into the weekend even better with a full reveal of the GHOSTS cover artwork designed by the legendary horror artist Graham Humphreys. 
"I put together my dream team of people I respect and admire for GHOSTS. Working with Graham - a horror hero of mine - has been truly wonderful. He has made some of the most iconic artwork in Horror history so its an honour to have him on this project!" - Jed Shepherd, Writer/Director of GHOSTS

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you for getting us to £100k, Cover Preview and More!
updates.update_content: “Reaching the £100k milestone is an incredible feeling and I am utterly blown away away by the support GHOSTS has had from the backers and media. We have a lot of hard work left to do on the game and so many exciting things to announce. The great Hideo Kojima once said ‘As a creator, I always want to betray fans' expectations.’ and that's exactly what I'm trying to achieve with GHOSTS. A game that still holds surprises on multiple playthroughs and an experience that you'll never forget.” -

Thank you all for your support of GHOSTS, these past (just under) two weeks has been a wild ride and we've been working feverishly behind the scenes to make our collectors edition even better and also adding some new rewards to the higher tiers too!

campaign.story:
What item did the chronomancer think was so important that he was willing to die fighting to keep it from your party? What did that monster leave behind when it fled into the forest last night? And what exactly happened when the wizard’s magic spell backfired?
Random tables can get boring quickly. Players eventually learn what a high die roll means versus a lower die roll. The same treasure or effect comes up multiple times during a campaign. Or the table just doesn’t fit with the vibe or mood of the game. All of these Harsch Tables are designed to give your game a mysterious edge that can greatly benefit or terrify the players in unexpected and creative ways.
A number of these tables were designed to work in Dice Monster Dice’s upcoming Harsch Kingdom game setting. Some notes and rules regarding gameplay in the Harsch Kingdom setting are included in this supplement. However, these tables can easily be used in any fantasy game setting with little or no adaptation. (Most of the results from these tables are setting-agnostic, and we’re willing to bet that if we didn’t tell you, you wouldn’t have even noticed!)
Let these Harsch Tables inspire your next gaming session, even if you don’t roll to use them. Maybe there’s a result on the Magic Misfire table that catches your imagination. Perhaps a member of the ettercap hunting party seen in the distance (Random Events) inspires you to create a unique NPC for your party to encounter. Or maybe that hobgoblin has come looking for his missing finger bone your player found on the Random Treasure/Items table three sessions ago.
Calling for your player to roll a percentage will never get old at your game table with the Harsch Tables.

UPDATE!
Thanks to you, we've met our Stretch Goals!
Stretch Goal #1 - $450 - New rules for  death and death saving throws. These optional Harsch Death rules make  the traditional three-death-saves rule in 5e more exciting and dangerous  for players and non-player characters alike! Created by Mike Marosits,  these rules will be included in the Harsch Tables Volume 1.
Stretch Goal #2 - $525 - An original  adventure (compatible with, but not restricted to, the Harsch Kingdom  campaign setting). This short adventure, written by Derek M. Koch, will  be designed for four 5th-7th level characters, and will be sent to ALL  backers as a separate PDF.

Work is continuing on Harsch Tables, Volume 1, and I can't wait for everyone to see what we've come up with so far! Mike Marosits has turned in his draft of the Harsch Death Rules, and I think you'll like what he's done with this new way to handle death in your 5e games.

updates.update_userinfo: Geniunely don't know what to say . . .
updates.update_content:
. . . except, "Thank you."
Okay. That's not fair. I'll try to come up with a few more things to say (I am a writer, after all!).
I've run a successful Kickstarter campaign before, but this is the first Kickstarter campaign I've launched in the tabletop role-playing game. I honestly didn't know what to expect. I've been a creator, a writer, a producer for decades, but my re-entry into the gaming hobby only happened last year. Don't get me wrong - I've thrown a LOT of dice in my day (as I've been detailing on the :) ), but I took a long break from the gaming table. I'm back now. I'm all in, and based on the success of this Kickstarter campaign, I feel like there's still a place for the kind of sword-and-sorcery fantasy I love when it comes to rolling those d20s!

To thank everyone even more (and to perhaps tease potential backers just a bit!), here are the first 20 entries of the Random Treasures/Items table. Treat it as a 1d20 Random Treasure/Items chart now as a preview of what the finished Harsch Tables Volume 1 will look like!

campaign.story:
A lot of art in a small amount of space.
Always 2 is a 8.5x11 inch, 158 full color artbook, with images on almost every page. I created this book because I wanted to showcase the different pieces that had gone into the graphic novel Hadrion The Butcher. I had started to realize that I had so many drawings from both that story as well as sketches and short stories about Hadrion and Elliot that I thought it might be nice to create a collection of art for the fans to have as well as helping the readers of these stories gain a better understanding of what I have been drawing for the past 3 years. Even if you have not read Hadrion’s tale or know of other characters from this tale, Always 2 gives the reader not only visual insight to my creative process but also gives fans and newcomers a closer look at the details of the artwork that you can’t see on social media. With the process photos, concept art, close ups, sketches and written insight, I hope to give you something special that can allow you to connect with the characters in a more intimate way and come to enjoy their story more.

This Kickstarter is a preorder campaign with perks and a lower price tag (the book will go up to $45 after the capaign). The book is completed and ready to print, I just wanted to offer something special to people who would like to preorder. The price on this campaign ensures that printing and shipping costs will be covered for those who ordered.

Thank you for your help and interest. You can watch the video or look at the images below to give you an insight to what it looks like.

Sincerely,
Tony Guaraldi-Brown

campaign.story:
We've reached out third stretch goal of $27,000!!! Thank you Monster Fans!! That means everyone who has backed at a physical reward tier will get a bonus comic book added to their reward tier. I'm excited to be able to add an additional book for readers to hold in their hands and dig into the Crescent City Monsters world.
Crescent City Monsters starts in 1963 with Jonas Atelus, a sorcerer who is deeply seated in the New Orleans supernatural world. Unknown to Jonas, a mysterious being puts a bounty on his head. Jonas is also an aspiring blues musician and on the night of his band's first paying gig, the monsters of Crescent City attack Jonas to collect the bounty. 
POST CHAPTER ONE SPOILERS: 
The events of that night change Jonas's life dramatically. He loses his powers and wakes up decades later in a new body and his memory fades in and out. With the unwittingly help of powerful teenage Creole Magic sorcerers, Jonas escapes from the outer-dimensional prison he was trapped in. His escape is just the beginning of this nightmare of a journey he's thrown into. 
Although Jonas escapes his outer-dimensional prison, there are other supernatural forces that see his existence as a threat and they plan to eliminate that threat.
Chapter four continues to dig deeper into the dark world of Crescent City Monsters and its characters. The story also explores how Jonas deals with having everything taken away from him while trying to figure out why a bounty was put on is head.
Check out more previews pages:
THE BOOKS
We're half way through completing issue four and part of the Kickstarter funds will be used to pay artist Gian Carlo Bernal to complete issue four.
This Kickstarter campaign will also help fund the printing of BOTH the trade and hardcover that collects issues 1-4 AND for individual copies of issue #4! So, if you already have issues 1-3 and want only issue 4, we've got you. 
The hardcover and trade will be 100+ pages of amazing black and white art and story with quality gloss paper that will make the artwork pop. The plan is to make the hardcover slightly larger than the trade so you can enjoy a closer look at Gian Carlo's amazing artwork.
Creator's Edition (PDF)
Included in all tiers will also be a bonus Creator's Edition PDF. This PDF will contain the line artwork and script for issue #1.
$16K:  DayBlack & Crescent City Monsters 
We're collaborating with Keef Cross, the creator of DayBlack, on a crossover with Crescent City Monsters. The first stretch goal will be a PDF of a 10-12 page crossover comic book drawn by Keef Cross added to every reward tier if we reach $16K. We're excited about this collaboration because of the incredible synergy between DayBlack and Crescent City Monsters. The story will take place before chapter one of Crescent City Monsters circa 1962, so we'll dig more into Crescent City Monster's main character, Jonas, and his life before the bounty was put on his head. For those of you who are new to DayBlack you'll be introduced to the main character, Merce, a former slave who was bitten by a vampire in the cotton fields. Four hundred years later, he works as a tattoo artist in the small town of DayBlack. Check out dayblackcomic.com for more of  Merce's story. 
Artist Gian Carlo Bernal and writer Newton Lilavois recently won the 2020 Glyph Comic Awards for BEST ARTIST, BEST WRITER, BEST COVER, and FAN AWARD FOR BEST WORK for their comic book series Crescent City Monsters.
WHY DID I CREATE THIS STORY? 
As a Haitian-American I wanted to introduce the rich Haitian Voodoo lore to comic books readers through more authentic lens. Mix that with my love for dark gritty stories and the urge to create a zombie story, and you have the delicious gumbo called Crescent City Monsters.
What are the fans saying?
"Great beginning and refreshing comic that has a great story to tell. The story placement is awesome and gives off a true world experience to the characters also great art as well." - Terrance S.
"One of the best comic books I have read in years. I purchase 500 plus comics per year, and this one is by far my favorite of 2020. The story has me completely hooked and anxious for more. The art work is phenomenal ."- James J.
"An amazing original tale! I've always been into supernatural comics like Blade, Midnight Sons, Ghost Rider, Doctor Strange, Man-Thing, and Crescent City Monsters takes it to a sophisticated level!" - Jesus S.
"Absolutely love the story line and the illustrations are definitely amazing! Would love to see the comics in color. Great job overall hope to see more soon. :)" - Tiesha S.

campaign.story:
Vampire (dot) Pizza is an episodic immersive experience delivered to your home. Become a Vampire through story, immersive puzzles, hidden messages, secret codes and creative challenges that transform you and your group. This year, the Vamps have created the first ever Vampire-made Kickstarter to save Human Halloween by delivering the holiday straight to you. It's Halloween delivered nationwide.


We Vampires know how difficult it can be to communicate.  There are hunters everywhere.  That’s why our human familiars - Vampire (dot) Pizza - have spent the last four months since the pandemic began helping us and also restaurants that need it. They've partnered with some of the best locally owned pizza joints in Los Angeles, Las Vegas, Philadelphia and New York to get my secret messages to you.  Nobody ever questions the pizza guy, right?
It’s an awesome partnership.  The restaurant delivers chapters of my master plan for you to play and solve.  In exchange, we order their delicious human food.  My cover shop restaurant partners have reported huge increases in sales because of their work together.  If a good human or two benefits because of our Vampire Revolution, well, I suppose I can live with that.  In an undead sorta way. 
For HH2020, VDP is doing things a little differently.  They love Halloween and want to go nationwide to help fill the void left by so many cancellations.  But, being familiars for just a few months now, they don't have restaurant partners everywhere quite yet.  So, order your experience here.  When you receive it in the mail, you'll find instructions on how to recruit your favorite neighborhood pizza place to join our #fangforce.  Think of it as reverse trick-or-treating and a great way to support local businesses that need us now more than ever.  By joining us for Human Halloween and the 1st Annual Vampire National Convention, not only will we save the best hunting night of the year, but VDP will be able to partner with more restaurants and be ready to deliver Chapter 3 to you in way more places.  
You can read more about Vampire (dot) Pizza in Forbes, Eater and Business Insider, to name a few.

campaign.story:
Greetings, Art Lovers and Macabre Mavens
Fifty years ago, NBC-TV premiered the bone-chilling, three-episode pilot that gave birth to the supernatural series Rod Serling’s Night Gallery. Millions of viewers were riveted to every episode—often watching through their fingers—as the uncanny events unfolded. After three seasons the show ended—but the memories lingered.
Though the quality of the episodes were hotly debated among fans and authorities from Stephen King to Guillermo del Toro, virtually all who tuned in agreed that the series’ most memorable elements were the paintings and sculptures showcased within. Chillingly introduced by the writer-host in his inimitable voice, these macabre masterpieces were the works of artists Thomas J. Wright, Jaroslav Gebr and Phil Vanderlei, and have remained the stuff of dreams and nightmares for generations. 
Jaroslav Gebr's stunning work for the Night Gallery pilot film.
A 25-Year Treasure Hunt
A quarter-century ago, an intrepid duo of dedicated Night Gallery historians banded together to dig deep into the history of the series. Co-authors Scott Skelton and Jim Benson wrote Rod Serling’s Night Gallery: An After Hours Tour, which provided the definitive history of the show—but sadly went to print without a single illustration from the series. Taylor L. White, publisher and proprietor of the genre emporium Creature Features, joined the search to bring the original paintings and sculptures to light.
For two and a half decades, this trio followed a trail around the world to discover the whereabouts of the paintings. The intense search grew to include a host of fellow aficionados, collectors, and historians, who painstakingly tracked down the whereabouts of each artful artifact, most presumed lost to the ages.
Art Not Found in Ordinary Museums
Now that search is complete, and Creature Features is proud to present the results: Rod Serling’s Night Gallery: The Art of Darkness, a deluxe art book measuring 11 x 11," comprising 316 pages with more than 300 illustrations, including every painting ever shown in the Night Gallery. This includes in-depth commentary and background from the artists themselves, plus never-before-seen concept art and memorabilia. 
Finding the paintings and licensing the artwork from NBC Universal has been a long, painstaking, and expensive process. Academy Award–winning writer-director Guillermo del Toro has joined the cause with an introduction to the book and offering access to the original paintings from his own vast personal collection.  The introduction has been penned by Anne Serling, Rod's daughter and author of her own book, As I Knew Him: My Dad, Rod Serling.
The book includes rare behind-the-scenes photos, promotional materials and concept sketches.
Authoritative, Exclusive, One-of-a-kind.
The result is a revelation, revealing the extraordinary talents of its artists while also tracing the surreal, riveting mystery of how these priceless treasures were lost, then found—for you, the reader, to be amazed by. Every image has been personally reviewed and approved by the Night Gallery Artist himself, Thomas J. Wright. 
"The Late Mr. Peddington" before and after restoration.
With the paintings now documented and the mysteries solved, we are now dedicated to bringing this book to you, the fellow fans of the fantastic, who are willing to take the final step of support to bring this book out of the darkness and on to your coffee tables and bookshelves. 

There have been substantial costs in retrieving, photographing, and restoring the paintings, not to mention licensing, writing and designing this deluxe book. Now we stand poised at the printers in need of your support. Your pledges will insure that we can produce a world-class, one-of-a-kind volume, and make it available for all of the fans, like you, who have clamored for it.
Thank you for considering our project. Our gratitude extends into the unknown.
Our Team
Authors Scott Skelton & Jim Benson share the title of world’s leading authorities on this series since penning their first book Rod Serling’s Night Gallery: An After Hours Tour for Syracuse Press in 1998. That led to co-producing the VHS release for Columbia House, producing a Night Gallery documentary for the Mystery Channel and consulting on the complete DVD release for Universal Home Video in 2007. Scott and Jim teamed up again to produce a “lost episode” from reconstructed segments for the Season Three DVD. Under oath, they still assert that Night Gallery is their Favorite. Show. Ever.
Artist Thomas J. Wright (billed as Tom Wright in the early ’70s), created 101 original paintings that embodied the supernatural shenanigans in the shadowy realm ofthe Night Gallery. His career began as illustrator on a pair of Alfred Hitchcock films and two more with Robert Wise before he made the jump to directing on the 1985 reboot of Serling’s Twilight Zone. His storied career includes helming over 30 years of television, including contemporary hit shows Supernatural and N.C.I.S. Tom still shows the same wicked grin when fans admit to being deeply scared by his work. “That’s the idea,” he deadpans.
Director Guillermo del Toro needs no introduction having won three Oscars for his work on The Shape of Water to say nothing of his genre masterpieces Cronos, Pan’s Labyrinth and Pacific Rim, to name a few. His devotion to Night Gallery is well-documented, with interviews and commentaries on the 2007 DVD releases. Del Toro credits his first viewing of “The Doll” as a key moment in his blossoming creativity (along with some unfortunate side effects). There’s no better evidence of his devotion to the series than the five original Night Gallery paintings currently residing in his vast collection of genre artifacts.
Scott Skelton, Jim Benson, Tom Wright, Anne Serling, Guillermo Del Toro, Joe Sikoryak, Taylor White
Anne Serling is the author of As I Knew Him: My Dad, Rod Serling. Anne serves on the board of directors of the Rod Serling Memorial Foundation and has been published in The Twilight Zone - The Original Stories; and The Twilight Zone Magazine in which she adapted two of her father's teleplays into short stories. She has launched the imprint Rod Serling Books as a showcase for her father’s works. Anne’s poetry has been published in The Cornell Daily Sun and Visions, other writing has appeared in Salon.com and The Huffington Post and she is currently writing a novel: Aftershocks.
Designer Joe Sikoryak has been leaving his dirty fingerprints on American pop culture for decades. As an art director in the music industry, he designed definitive soundtrack albums for Star Trek, Mission: Impossible, Lost In Space, the Jaws series and nearly 800 others. He’s also designed hundreds of books, magazines, posters and film titles, and now is thrilled to frame The Art of Darkness in a deluxe edition worthy of Tom Wright and Rod Serling’s vision. He blames his unholy love of flush-right type on… Night Gallery.
Over four decades, Creature Features was known as a leading purveyor of movie magic and genre greatness with a legendary store in Burbank that attracted fans and pros alike. Its publishing imprint has produced such popular and award-winning titles as The Fantasy Worlds of Irwin Allen, The Outer Limits at 50, The Making of Star Trek - The Motion Picture and FXRH.  Owned and operated by Taylor L. White, Creature Features continues to produce cast & crew reunion screenings, genre-themed art exhibits and the Sleepy Hollow Film Festival in Tarrytown NY. But The Art of Darkness may be its greatest achievement—a maniacal, globe-spanning project that has lasted for 20 years to this day. Now that’s scary.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As the digital world expands, the market for print continues to shrink. We believe that the experience of reading a book, and seeing the paintings at large scale, color-corrected and carefully presented, is the superior choice. But traditional books are a costly undertaking, and we can only afford to do justice to these exceptional works of art with your support. We cannot bring the book to you without an enthusiastic and committed audience.

After years of substantial investment in licensing, photography and restoration, we need your financial support to cover the remaining printing and marketing costs.

ATTENTION INTERNATIONAL CUSTOMERS: Please be advised that international buyers are responsible for all taxes, customs, and import fees.

Please be mindful of potential delays caused by the global pandemic. We appreciate your support and your patience.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Greetings from the hallowed halls of the NIGHT GALLERY!
At long last, the official website for Rod Serling's THE ART OF DARKNESS is now live at Home | Night Gallery The Art of Darkness for all to partake.  The site features a deep dive into the show's history and legacy---and opens the doors of our long-awaited NIGHT GALLERY Gift Shop, showcasing a cacophonous cauldron of ghoulish delights.
As you requested, you'll find a sinister selection of exclusive prints, assorted oddities and souvenirs, and all versions of THE ART OF DARKNESS, including the remaining copies of our highly collectible slipcase edition. Take note of the terrifying treasures previously offered thru our Kickstarter campaign—supplies are limited!  And check back often as new items will be added in the weeks ahead, including our NIGHT GALLERY Fan Club Kit!

updates.update_content:
All rewards from the TUNE IN DAN'S CAFE and LINDEMANN'S CATCH categories have been mailed and should arrive within the week.  
Also, there are still 40+ backers who have not supplied us with their shipping information.  If you're seeing these updates, but are still having trouble accessing our Kickstarter survey, check the spam mail folder thru your e-mail service, or e-mail your address directly to us at: cfeatures@me.com.

As of Friday, February 12th at 5pm, all books have been shipped from the eleven tiers.  Each package was sent by USPS Media Mail which can take 2 to 7 days for delivery to the West Coast and 5 to 14 days for other parts of the country.  International orders average 7 days to 4 weeks depending on whether your customs opts to inspect your order.
Major thanks to Matthew Abrams, Ian Henny, Mirren Henny, Finn Traxler, Claire White, Eddie Hernandez and Joe Sikoryak for battling the overwhelming logistics of Covid-19, brutal weather, a downtrodden Post Office and other general unhappiness to process, pack and ship your orders.  Their efforts were beyond herculean in every way and were the final key in successfully bringing this project over the finish line.

updates.update_userinfo: SHIPPING UPDATE #4 - WITCHES FEAST + SURVEY RESPONSES
updates.update_content:
We have received confirmation that the deluxe slipcased editions (purchased under the WITCHES FEAST tier) will be delivered to our warehouse on Monday, February 8th.   Local pick-up's can be arranged beginning Tuesday, February 9th.  Appointments can be made by e-mailing cfeatures@me.com 24 hours in advance of your visit.  
Also, we still have 75 backers who have not responded to our survey requesting your shipping information.  A handful of you have alerted us that our message was routed to your spam folders, so if you're receiving these updates, please check ASAP.

As of Monday, February 1st, we have processed, packed and shipped nearly half of the Kickstarter orders and hope to have the remaining 50% enroute within the next 10 days.  
Please note that with certain tiers, the rewards are being shipped from a different location and may arrive separately from your book order.   Also, those who have received their orders can attest to the care and attention that are being paid to each package being meticulously assembled to insure its safe delivery.  We continue to appreciate your patience as our crew gives its full attention in completing your orders.

Greetings Art Lovers. Over the past year we've been counting the days until ROD SERLING'S NIGHT GALLERY - THE ART OF DARKNESS would arrive in our eager hands (or claws, talons, tentacles, etc.) But for the last month, waiting has truly become a nail-biting experience.
The books are completed, and are en route from our printer in Singapore. But as you may have heard, there are shipping snarls worldwide due to a record-breaking holiday season — and the accompanying pandemic. campaign.story:
Ghosts! Ghouls! Mystery! The Occult! 
 Second-Hand books? 
Saxon’s Second-Hand Books is a supernatural adventure written by Ash Deadman (Murder Most Mundane, The Hanged Man, Cadavers: World Gone To Hell).
Set in a Neo-Victorian London, beautifully realised by the art of Gustaffo Vargas (Manu, L1ma, Trujillo, Crayta: Sunset). 
Donald Arthur Saxon operates a second-hand bookshop in an "up and coming" area of London in the 1870s. He doesn't sell many books, but he has a nice sideline solving supernatural mysteries. 
Thanks to a secret he is keeping, he has an unmatched insight into the paranormal.
Having investigated a haunting at her home, Saxon teams up with Charlotte Thompson, a young widow with an appetite for danger. 
She brings to his attention information regarding an increasing amount of mysterious events around the city.
They realise the events are all linked by an occult symbol and each event is more deadly than the last. 
Saxon’s Second-Hand Books #1 launches a 5-part miniseries that leads our heroes on a tour of London's spookiest places as they get ever closer to the person behind these nefarious goings on.
It features reference to real life hauntings and ghost stories in a city known for its terrifying history. The story draws on horror and mystery inspirations to deliver a fast-paced tale set in a time period when people were fascinated by the occult.
REWARDS
Saxon’s Second-Hand Books #1 is a 28 page full colour comic book, available with 2 different covers. 
Sachi Ediriweera variant cover
Gustaffo Vargas cover
Original character design art
DMR free Digital version of the book
Faye Stacey's art print


Physical bundle of Mad Robot #1s
So... what is SAXON's secret?.......
STRETCH GOALS PRINT PACKAGE!
While we were putting together the project we were concerned that our creative team had become somewhat male-dominated. This would be misaligned with a story with such a kick-ass leading lady as Saxon's Second-Hand Books' Charlotte Thompson. For our print package we've therefore taken steps to address that. We've arranged a set of art prints all by super talented female artists, to go alongside the print by Faye Stacey which you'll receive if you back our Phantom tier or above.
Stretch goal 1 - Rosie Packwood Art Print - Unlocked
Stretch Goal Art Print 1 (Rosie Packwood)
Stretch goal 2 - Jenn Lee Art Print - Unlocked
Example of Jenn Lee's Art - Not the final print
THE TEAM 
Ash Deadman is a science teacher - making him the ideal person to write about history! Ash's comic book writing credits include Murder Most Mundane and The Hanged Man. He was also a contributor to the Cadavers: World Gone to Hell anthology. Saxon is his magnum opus - the story he has always wanted to tell.  
Yes - you've been to New York, Ash. You are not special.
Gustaffo Vargas is a Peruvian comic book artist and writer based in Edinburgh, UK. Since 2017 he's been self-publishing his Peruvian Cyberpunk comic series MANU, L1MA & TRUJILLO.  MANU won the 2019 Best UK Independent Comic of the Year. He is a member of the SkrawlLordz. He has worked with Dan Abnett as principal artist for Crayta: Sunset and for UK independent publishers such as Accent UK, Madius Comics and in Peru for In Planet Stereo and Carboncito.  
He is geniunely that nice and happy in real life.
Rob Jones is a writer and letterer of comics. He has lettered such comics as 24 Panels for Image Comics, Nicnevin and the Bloody Queen for Humanoids, Yasmeen for Scout Comics, DC Thomson's Commando Comics, The Broons and Oor Wullie, as well as most of Mad Robot Comics books including Murder Most Mundane and The Hanged Man. 
Rob is the one on the lef...... er....... hang on.... I know this.....
Mad Robot and Saxon Editor Matt Hardy wanted to write his own Bio. Too bad we didn't let him...

updates.update_content: The print copies of Saxon’s Second-Hand Books have arrived and are being posted out: -
By now your collective inboxes should contain a drive link with your digital copy of SAXON’s Second Hand Books.

A quick update for you lot - with a ton of art.
Gustaffo has finished all the art for issue 1 and the book went to letterer extraordinaire Rob Jones yesterday.  Rob will letter and format for printing - and then it’s the job that everyone loves - enveloping and mailing ;)
Gustaffo has signed on for the rest of the series, Ash has completed the script for issue 2 and Matt has spilt tea on it. Twice.

The next event in our Mad Robot 2021 publishing line-up is live on Kickstarter now.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/153289885/bete-noir-books-2-and-3

Hi backers!
Hope all is well with you. 
Since we last spoke, Gustaffo has been hard at work, churning out incredible pages at an equally incredible rate.
The pencils for the entire issue are complete, and inks and colours are well underway. Speaking of which...

Hi Backers
Hope you're having an excellent 2021 so far. We just wanted to get in touch to say that things are really motoring with Saxon now and it's all coming together wonderfully. Gustaffo has some truly wonderful, innovative page layouts for you and we wanted to share some of his thumbnails to give you an idea of what's in store.

We've had a few requests for updates on the book. Even with Gustaffo working on both Saxon and his creator owned project PUNO - we are still on schedule to hit our February delivery date. 

Ash and Gustaffo have the world of Saxon all mapped out, the prints are ready to go, Ash has submitted his script for issue 2 and is researching buildings with real life Ghost Stories for issues 3 and 4 - and Matt, well Matt gets to write these updates. He loves making comics so it keeps him quiet ;)

Big thanks to everyone who completed their surveys. Ash is hard at work on the script for issue 2 and Gustaffo is ploughing ahead with the art for issue 1.
But he’s a busy dude is Gustaffo - as well as SAXON and his work on Crayta - he has his creator own series currently doing rather well on Kickstarter.
We’ll let him do the talking: -

Dearest backers
That's it. The campaign is done and dusted. We've taken a day to send this out because, to be honest, we didn't exactly have the words to express how grateful we are for the support you have given us. We still don't. The final total and especially the backer number have completely bowled us over. Thank you so, so much for helping us make Saxon's Second-Hand Book's a reality. Now it's up to us to make the absolute best book we can for you and that is exactly what we intend to do.

campaign.story:
Success! We did it and I'm more than excited to see this book come to fruition. But, let's not stop and keep this truck rolling to further heights! Stretch Goals! If we can raise just little more we can get all Patrons a sticker! And even better yet if we can keep going a get a small book full of my crazy and drawings. Lets go!
The Vapor is about a troubled kid  named Lester who lives in a small town that becomes the victim of  supernatural happenings.  This otherworldly presence corrupts specific  locals and Lester finds himself in the middle of it all. This comic is inspired by the surreal and horror of contemporary society. Take a left turn with the comic artist and writer, Anthony Pugh, to a strange scenic route in...The Vapor.
"Deep into that darkness peering, long I stood there, wondering, fearing,  doubting, dreaming dreams no mortal ever dared to dream before."  -Edgar Allan Poe
Inspired by actual events in history and personal experiences, The Vapor is a juxtapose of 80's horror films and indie comic art. Over the years as an illustrator, artist and muralist, my work has had this reoccurring character, a disheveled man like child. A character that haunted me  every time I drew him. What was his story? I've always been fascinated with lore and urban mythology, from Bigfoot to UFO sightings. Pulling  from some urban lore and an actual personal experience I tethered these concepts  into one crooked story. This is the nightmare at the corner of your  eye, the shadow behind the shower curtain, cruel thoughts creeping into  your daily life. This is ...The Vapor...
Cover Art
Preview Art Sneak Peak!
Rewards
Note: The $45 reward is a chosen random art piece done on varied sized 4"x6" masonite, with ink and acrylic.
Note: For custom artwork, request something preferable comic book orientated concepts, I love drawing monsters and ol spiderman. But, open to whatever topic.
Note: Both the Digital illustration and Digital Cover illustration will be a digital file, PSD, JPEG or PDF that will be uploaded for you to download onto your computer. I can illustrate a character for your comic or a character for you anime, use the image how ever you want. Feel free to ask questions about these rewards.
Note: All rewards will be mailed in sturdy mailers

 What am I trying to do?
To find support and backing of this short series of books. Though this story and concept is far from the mainstream industry, I'm hoping to find an audience and support through Kickstarter. Aside from making the comic, I'm developing the mystery and lore of this world by also creating paintings, mini-shorts and illustrations. I have been developing this story for the past year but working with this character for over 15 years. I have issue  1 completely done and 2 more comics planned for 2020.
Why should I back this project?
 Well, first and foremost  you are supporting an independent creative vision, and a comic written and illustrated by one creative who has poured his heart into an idea. Secondly, your support helps this  creative bring this book into the competitive foray of the comic book  industry, companies like Marvel and  DC have the backing of corporate  money from Disney and Time Warner, something my lovely self cannot even compete with. So, every dollar isn’t taken  for granted. And lastly, new voices only benefits comics all around, supporting my comic contributes to the wonderful spectrum of culture and diversity in the comic book industry.
This comic book is DONE, drawn, inked, lettered and ready to be sent to the printers! So, as soon as the campaign is done we can  get 'er printed and fulfill the rewards.
Who is this guy?
My name is Anthony Pugh, artist residing in Brooklyn, New York. Over the past ten years I’ve worked on many projects doing a bit of design, illustration, paintings, comics and mural artwork. This is my second Kickstarter campaign and when this concept hit me,  I wanted nothing but to bring this into reality. Bringing all my  influences from Horror movies and old Creepy Comics. I grew up in  Minnesota and started doing graffiti on freight trains, I experienced a few weird spooky nights at 3am with the vapor of paint twisting ones mind. Pulling a string through  all of this and conjuring something strange to paper. I hope you join me  and help me out on this comic book. Please scroll back up and see what  reward fits you and let's bring this to life.

updates.update_content: Hey folks so giving ya update. The books are printed! I'm stoked, everything looks all good and great! So, the only snags was I had to change up the sticker to a different shape and couldn't get the die cut shape, the printer I was planning to use was closed due to covid, so I found another company that made a bigger 3" x 6" rectangle shape. Sorry about that. Also, in my own faulty self, I posted for the stretch goals that we would print a 8.5" x 11" manga sized book.. BUT I meant a 5.5" x 8.5" sized manga art book. So I goofed on that, the book looks dope and I'm stoked for you to get this lil jam of art. Also, I am working away at the custom art stuff! I'm excited to work these out for these patrons.

Hey Folks wanted send a quick update on whats up. Everything so far is on track, just waiting on Kickstarter to collect funds and what not. I am in contact with the printers and they are still in operation, but they are little slower than usual. And I actually stopped by my USPS and talked to the staff and they are working on schedule but a little slower than usual. So, my plans to get stuff shipped out in May is still a go. If any snags or delays I will keep you posted here. So, Thanks again for supporting me on this project, seriously its anchor keeping me on task during these crazy as times. Love y'all, stay healthy and stay safe.

We did it!!! Wow really big thank you to everyone throwing in that extra help the last day! I am extremely humbled for all the support and during these testing times. The best part is we made our 2nd stretch goal!! 🎉🎉YES!🎉🎉 So everyone who contributed $10 and up will be getting this little art zine jam bonus art book. Full of some ink drawings, sketches and some funky concepts.  And everyone will get a CBR/PDF of the book also. So, the next step is I'm going to be sending out reward surveys in the next few days. To collect mailing addresses and any other info, please fill that info out. And for all who are getting custom art please make sure you let me know what you want for your custom piece, I will be working on those right away so we get all of that you. Also feel free to email me at anthonypughart@gmail.com with any questions or info on your custom art request!

Hey Folks! First off, I hope everyone is safe and healthy, some crazy times we live in. Secondly, THANK YOU for supporting me on this endeavor, I'm super excited to take this all to the next step. The book is ready to get printed and as far as I know the printer company is still up and running, so if there is any snags or issues I will keep you posted.

Hey folks! So, wow I'm just looking over this little possible art book I wanna get y'all, we got 11 days and just a little over $300 to raise and this extra reward scores. So, yeah some more pushing and grinding on this campaign we are so close! So, feel free to share and tell some folks. I know we live in some crazy times, but man when has it not been crazy, so keep doing the thing! I super appreciate the support

UNLOCKED 1st Tier
⚡️⚡️ALL patrons who contributed $10 and up will receive a sticker!!⚡️⚡ This is super awesome and yeah we get something to stick on our favorite things....or on an ice machine at the local bodega, no I'm joking. But, thank you seriously, I'm super humbled by the support and more excited to see if we can push this to another tier. I would love to get everyone an additional reward for backing my campaign! A manga sized book collection of my work, which includes finished inked drawings, sketches from drink and draw/life drawings, digital drawings and some other cool stuff. I'm shooting for color covers and black and white interiors (most of my stuff is B/W) about 32 pages. This would be a great companion to The Comic and other rewards. So all patrons $10 and up would a physical copy of "Ritual" Anthony Pugh Art and a every patron would get a PDF/CBR digital copy of this also. Let's get this next tier we are super close! Thanks!

Hey Folks! Again I wanna THANK YOU for your support these campaigns are tough and exhausting so thank you for backing and the kind words. I want to keep this ship rolling to the next level and reach for the next plateau. Which will be awesome! We can get more rewards and art. If we can get to $2,300 everyone who contributed $10 and up will get a sticker! Which you can slap on your local stop sign, (no don't do that,haha) you can put on your fridge or item that needs a sticker. Alas, spread the word and lets keep this moving along!

campaign.story:
Help us change the perceptions of Native and Indigenous people through pop culture!
Since 2014, Native Realities has been the leader in supporting and promoting Native and Indigenous pop culture arts and artists.  From award winning comics to the only Native comic shop in the world to the original Indigenous Comic Con, Native Realities has paved the way for Native Creatives to express themselves in positive and dynamic ways.
In 2016, we founded the Indigenous Comic Con as a way to bring attention to the incredible work being done by Native Creatives that goes beyond the traditional assumptions of Native art.
Why is this important?  Let's take a little trip through history...
Natives In Pop Culture
For more than 400 years, Native people have been portrayed in negative and stereotypical ways in popular media.  From the Noble Savage to the Crying Indian, the realities of Native existence have been misrepresented and worse erased from the collective consciousness.  These portrayals have had significant repercussions on Native communities and specifically Native youth as there is a direct correlation between negative representations and damage to self-esteem, self-worth, and self-determination.
For many decades, Native artists and creatives have had a difficult time pushing against the confines of the identifying images Western society has perpetuated for several centuries.  The rise of the Indigenerd has allowed for Native Creatives to begin to dictate a new Native and Indigenous identity: one that is not bound by historical tragedy but rather is grounded in tradition, resilience, and celebration; an identity that  moves toward a bright and brilliant future.
IndigiPop X
Beginning in 2019, the Indigenous Comic Con became IndigiPop X, a pop culture festival celebrating the numerous aspects of Indigenous identity in pop culture.  Not just comics but futurisms, food, music, theater, and many other forms of creative expression.  Our main objectives for the festival have always revolved around two goals:
 Supporting Native Creatives - Native Creatives are the bedrock of our Indigenous communities.  They bring their traditions, values, culture, and aesthetics to everything they create.  Our work revolves around fostering a space where Native artists and artisans can explore and experiment in pop culture media, expand their professional networks, and find a larger audience with which to engage.
 Supporting Native Youth - Native young people have many obstacles due to systemic oppression, poverty, and lack of resources.  Our work is dedicated to showcasing and promoting positive and dynamic representations of Native people that can inspire and empower Native young people in becoming the superheroes of their own stories.  We want to unleash their imaginations so they can build better worlds for themselves, their families and their communities!
These goals are the core of our work and have guided our projects and collaborations for more than a half decade. 
Rewards
Now for the good stuff...with help from one of our most incredible sponsors, Meow Wolf, we are able to offer some great rewards!  You can get cool rewards but also you can spread the word. 
So why run a Kickstarter?
Here's the crux of it all...
For four years, we have run successful events that have drawn crowds from the southwest and around the world.  From Albuquerque to Denver to Melbourne, our conventions have brought joy, celebration and Indigenerdity to Natives and non-Natives alike.  However, we think we can bring this work to more people and crowdfunding is the perfect platform for us to engage a wider audience to learn about this work and, more importantly, support this work.  
Through this support we will be able to:
Expand our programming to bring more Native artists to the festivals.  This includes more chefs, more wrestlers, more illustrators, more game designers, more writers, more actors...more Native Creatives in all areas where they are underrepresented.
Move beyond Albuquerque and the southwest. There are so many locations we want to  explore and so many invitations from Native communities we have had to turn down because we don't have the capacity to be in all places.  With extra support we can offer more mini-cons and bring IPX to communities who are excited about this work.
Develop more projects, products, and offerings.  All our profits from our past conventions have gone back into developing comics, games, collectibles and more that feature Native and Indigenous characters and communities.  The more we are able to raise, the more we can expand our offerings throughout the world. 
Allow community and supporters to have a stake in the work.  Perhaps the most important reason: you!  By supporting IPX and all our pop culture work, you are actively engaging in changing the representations of Native and Indigenous people throughout the world.  You become a shareholder in our success!
Imagine how awesome would it be if the kids and community at Pine Ridge could meet and hang out with Eugene Braverock or the voice cast of Navajo Star Wars? 
How much of an impact would it have for youth and elders at White Lake learn more about Indigenous Futurisms from Elizabeth LaPensée or Drew Hayden Taylor?
 What if the world could see all the brilliance and complexities of Native people through the art of Tim Truman, Weshoyot Alvitre, or Jeffrey Veregge?
 Supporting IndigiPop X is not just helping to host a convention, it is a way to change the perceptions of Native and Indigenous people through pop culture!
Supporting this Kickstarter means you are supporting all our efforts from festivals to comics to networks to distribution.
Supporting Native and Indigenous people is more than just going to a powwow.  It is more than just liking a cause on Facebook.  It is more than just supporting Standing Rock.  It is supporting Native and Indigenous Creatives and expanding the opportunities to promote and develop their work, their craft, their networks.
Where does your support go?
IndigiPop X Events: ABQ (March 2020) and SoCal (October 2020), as well as our future events into 2021 and beyond!
Work and connections for Native Creatives
Supporting Native youth to participate in a life-affirming event
Native Realities Team
 Dr. Lee Francis 4
Led by our Founder, Dr. Lee Francis 4 (Pueblo of Laguna), Native Realities has been changing the face of pop culture since 2014.  Known as the Stan Lee of Native Comics, Dr. Francis has been responsible for producing more than a dozen Indigenous-centric comics, founding the Indigenous Comic Con, and opening Red Planet Books and Comics.  He is an award-winning designer and writer and has spent more than two decades working with Native youth and communities in developing positive narratives and dynamic representations
Aaron Cuffee
Mr. Cuffee (Montauk/Shinnecock) has been with Native Realities since its founding and currently serves as the Chief Creative Officer and Director of Operations.  His strong background in writing and deep knowledge of comic book history give him the perfect skill set to meet the goals and objectives of Native Realities.
Kenn Rodriguez
Mr. Rodriguez (Latinx) is the Communications Coordinator for Native Realities and Red Planet and handles all the social media interactions for the various sites.
Nina Sisneros
Ms. Sisneros is our Guest Liaison and Shop/Merchandise Coordinator for Native Realities and Red Planet Books and Comics.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
You're not just supporting an event, you're supporting a movement.

We have done this for four years, we have run a very successful Kickstarter (Deer Woman), and have continued to develop projects and products throughout that time. So we have a great track record of meeting our goals for supporters and funders.

HOWEVER, there is always a chance that something goes awry. Hosting large scale events have inherent dangers: venue or guest cancellation, programming challenges, funding issues.

YET, we've never failed to offer our events or programming, so we think the risks are fairly low.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Chronicles of Van Helsing: Blood Will Out
Blood Will Out is a horror western tale set in the Chronicles of Van Helsing world.  It stars Jeanie Marie, matriarch of the Van Helsing clan (and hero of issue one), as a young girl.  Following a string of cattle mutilations, Jeanie’s father, brothers, and local ranchers form a party to find out who has been feeding on their cattle.  They fear the source to be supernatural.  Jeanie, frustrated at being left behind and compelled by dreams and visions, sneaks out of her house and into the woods, armed with an old rifle and a machete.
Soon she encounters a pair of shape shifting were-creatures, and is forced to do battle against a much stronger foe.  Meanwhile, the hunting party has tracked a larger band of the creatures into an underground cavern, and is now trapped and outnumbered.
Blood Will Out is written and illustrated by Tony Morgan, cover artist for the Chronicles of Van Helsing series, as well as artist for Issue One.  It is based on characters created by Adam Watson.  It will be a 32 page issue comic with full color interiors.
Chronicles of Van Helsing: Blood Will Out Cover
While this is set in the Chronicles of Van Helsing world, it is a self contained one-shot that does not require any previous knowledge in order to enjoy.
Chronicles of Van Helsing: Blood Will Out Page #4
Eighteen of thirty-two pages are currently completed.  Due to the time involved in hand painting each sequential page, we estimate that the project will be fully completed in April of 2020.  The printing process generally takes seven to fourteen days for printing and delivery.  We will be mailing all of the incentives out upon arrival of the books, starting in May of 2020.
Chronicles of Van Helsing: Blood Will Out Page #16
Rewards
We have some fantastic rewards lined up for this Kickstarter.  We have physical and digital editions of Blood Will Out available, with the digital edition being available via the early bird tier for just $1.  We have a comics pack that features all of the Chronicles of Van Helsing issues to date, a T-Shirt that features a brand new Chronicles of Van Helsing image by Tony Morgan and loads of original artwork which include all of the pages from Blood Will Out, pages from issue #1 and the covers for issues #2, 3 and 4.

The biggest risk is that completion and/or printing may take longer than anticipated. We have dealt with all of these challenges in the past and know how to overcome them. We will do our absolute best to communicate with the backers at all times about any challenges that we face.

updates.update_content:
I have sent out all of the packages that I can.  Tracking numbers have been sent via Kickstarter messages.  There are still a few backers that I haven’t heard from yet.  If you haven’t filled out the survey, please take a moment to fill it out or e-mail me with your address (and T-shirt size if you ordered one).  My e-mail is adamwatson@darkslinger.com
Thank you all once again for making this project a success!  I really can not express just how much your support means to us.  Thank you for the patience you showed while we navigated the hurdles that this year threw at us.
I have had a few backers ask what our next Kickstarter will be.  After giving it a lot of thought I have decided that the next project is going to be a bit smaller.  We will soon be running a campaign for Christmas themed Minislingers enamel pins.  Early in 2021 (most likely around April or May) we will be running a much larger campaign that will fund a Chronicles of Van Helsing hardcover.  This hardcover will feature a brand new cover by Tony.  I will update you all as that draws near.

Tony and I were able to meet up yesterday to sign copies for everyone who wanted them signed.  The signature might be found on the front cover, front interior or back cover unless a spot was specified.  We tried to place them in the least obtrusive spots where they would look the coolest.  
I will be packaging as many orders as possible tomorrow and send out another batch on Monday.  I will send a tracking number through the Kickstarter messages as soon as I have one.

The printed editions arrived today and I think they look fantastic!  I will immediately start prepping shipments so that the first batch can go out on Monday.  I will be sending out the unsigned copies first.  Tony and I are currently setting up a time to get together so that we can get copies signed.  Tracking numbers will be sent to you through Kickstarter’s messaging service. 
If you haven’t filled out the survey yet, please take a moment to do so.  Thank you all once again for supporting this project!  We hope you love it as much as we do.

Sorry for back-to-back updates but I forgot to mention that we can offer a unisex tank top instead of a t-shirt.  If you would like this option, just include the word ”tank” in the survey in the space for the shirt size.  I can order a tank specifically made for women, but they would cost an additional $10.  if you would prefer that option, send me a message through Kickstarter.  Thank you all once again for your support!

updates.update_userinfo: The Comics Are On Their Way
updates.update_content:
I recieved word from the printer today that the books have shipped!  if all goes according to plan they will be recieved this Friday. I will be sending out surveys tonight.  please get the surveys back as soon as possible as this will allow me to immediately start processing shipments.  If you paid extra to get another shirt, please include all sizes that you will need in the section that asks for t-shirt size.  
The surveys will include the option for autographs.  Tony is the writer and artist on Blood Will Out, the artist on Chronicles of Van Helsing 1 and the cover artist for issues 2-5.  Adam is the writer of issues 1-5 and the Sally special.  If you would like an autograph(s), please make a note of which books you would like signed and preferred placement of the signature (cover, inside of the front cover, etc...)

Sorry for the lack of updates.  I think we will all agree that 2020 just needs to stop.  Whoever has been writing this year needs to take a break and ask for feedback from a proper editor.  Two weeks ago I had a personal setback that was caused by my daughter’s appendix bursting.  She spent the week in the hospital but is doing well now.
We experienced a much larger setback this week.  Several fires started around our town on Monday.  At first this didn’t seem to be overly concerning but then Tuesday morning we discovered the severity.  These weren’t a few small fires.  They are large, fast burning forrest fires that are devouring everything in their path.  We were put on stage 1 at around noon and at 3:30 police officers drove down our streets with loud speakers telling us to leave our homes.  The days that have followed have been extremely tense.  on Thursday we were told that the fire was a mere 5 hours away from hitting Molalla.  Luckily this hasn’t happened yet.  The firefighters in our area are doing a great job and several townies have headed up with equipment, shovels, etc...to help create fire barriers.  If you have ever listened to the podcast or met me at a con, then you might know Robert Diaz.  Robert has been up there digging trenches in the hopes of stopping the fire.

Thank you all so much for your support and patience!  The production phase is now completed.  Digital editions have been sent out via Kickstarter messages.  The files have been sent to the printer.  Please note that there may be production delays caused by the Covid slowdown.  We will let you all know as soon as we have a delivery date.  Please let us know if you have any questions or comments.
Thank you all once again for your support!
