campaign.story:
Dustpans are dirty, ineffective and frustrating. Everybody has one and NOBODY likes it! To us, they are the enemy. That’s why we invented VaBroom!
No more annoying dustpan lines or bending over. With VaBroom, just sweep into a pile or line. Then tilt to the side, and the the pressure activated switch on the nozzle turns on the vacuum power! That's right, just suck up dirt and debris and then drop it in the trash.
It's that easy! Just Sweep, Suck and SEE YA! 
VaBroom is lightweight, but POWERFUL!  So we ask ourselves, will it suck?  
 Step 1.  Sweep 
Step 2.  Suck 
Step 3.  Eject into trash. See-ya! 

Overview:
Capacity
VaBroom can hold approximately 1 cup of debris at a time. That's about 2,367 Rice Krispies®! 
Power Source
VaBroom is powered by four (4)-AA batteries. On average, get over 500 uses per charge!
Motor and Impeller
VaBroom boasts a 14,000 RPM motor with specially designed impeller to create powerful suction while remaining lightweight.


Our Design Challenge: 
Create a lightweight cleaning tool with built-in powerful suction, that effectively eliminates the need for a dustpan. 
PLAY

 Product Testing:  
The nozzle design evolved from sequential testing to maximize suction and ease of use.  Additionally, we tested numerous combinations of motors, impellers and power sources to dial-in the best solution while keeping VaBroom lightweight.
PLAY

 Refinement:  
Once the proper function was achieved by our engineers, our industrial design team then completed an iterative approach at refining VaBroom.  Customer surveys were completed with hundreds of participants and improvements were developed based on direct feedback from the user.
PLAY

PLAY

Form and Function:
The last step was to make VaBroom beautiful.  Now that function had been maximized, we wanted to give VaBroom a modern, sleek look -- again, based on feedback from hundreds of users, we arrived at our current colorways, textures and finish.  


Welcome to Enhance Product Development, the creators of VaBroom. Here is where we work each day, coming up with unique solutions to some challenging problems. You might be asking, who is Enhance? Well, within our team you'll meet dog lovers, little league coaches, wedding DJs, beer connoisseurs and karaoke rock stars.  
Though we come from varied backgrounds, one passion we all share is a love for innovation. At the heart of that passion is a drive to develop meaningful solutions that resonate with our customers. We are curious, inquisitive, analytical, quirky, and sometimes a little edgy. We enjoy the open collaboration with our clients and tend to push the boundaries of conventional thinking. Our focus is to offer cost effective solutions with intrinsic value that create results.
Lastly, it is our enthusiasm that truly sets us apart. We actually love what we do and look forward to putting that enthusiasm to work for you, our backers!  
So from all of us, we thank you for considering backing our project and we will be providing you with updates on our progress in the weeks and months ahead!
We need you! And no, we're not just saying it. We really need your help. Without your support we can’t start the production of VaBroom and tie up the last loose ends in development. We have been working hard to create the best product possible and we want to release it to the world ASAP! We have finalized the prototype and now we need your help to get the production volumes up to get the prices down. It’s that simple!

About the book
THE WALLACE MYSTERY, the latest entry in Rick Geary’s Little Murder Library series, tells the story of one of Britain’s most famous and baffling unsolved murders. On the evening of January 20, 1931, Liverpool insurance agent William Wallace is called away from his home for a mysterious business appointment. He returns two hours later to find his wife, Julia, bludgeoned to death in their parlor. With few clues and no plausible suspects (and the murder weapon having vanished), the police at last arrest the husband. After a trial, he is exonerated, and the puzzle remains to this day. Raymond Chandler called this case, “The nonpareil of all murder mysteries.”
This book will be published in the same 6x9 full color, softcover format as our previous volume, 'Chester and Grace: The Adirondack Murder'.

campaign.story:
Welcome to the Kickstarter page for Miskatonic High #1! 
To quickly find out what our comic is about, you can watch the trailer (it’s right up above). But if you still have questions, we’re here to answer them!
Yes, it’s a comic book with 24 pages filled with chills, humor and a little real-life pathos. 
Well, do you like…
Fun comic books like Sabrina, Saga and Crossed?
Fun movies like Evil Dead 2, The Breakfast Club and Beetlejuice?
Fun TV shows like Stranger Things, The Chilling Adventures of Sabrina and Friday Night Lights?
Then you’ll probably like this comic too! (However, if you don’t like fun, we have a tedious copyright disclaimer written in our best legalese that might be right up your alley!)
Five teens take on H.P. Lovecraft’s monsters and their small-town high school … They’re just not sure which is worse.
Miskatonic High is an ongoing series packed with light horror, tongue-in-cheek humor and the amazing artwork of Ryan Mendoza (who can draw just about anything with a tentacle).
Parental advisory: There’s so many great series for young adults nowadays that you might be fooled into buying this for your five-year-old, but this series is rated PG-13 and more for teens and above.
In the rustic hills of a small New England Berkshire town lies the prestigious Miskatonic High School. When the Community Service Club goes on a field trip, they’ll be launched on a terrifying adventure that will change their lives while birthing an evil into our modern century. 
This is the beginning of the six-issue first season of the new high school horror series Miskatonic High.
We hope so, but here are some unbiased reviews.
Jenn Marshall of Sirens of Sequentials said:
“Miskatonic High is a fun story that balances everything you want in a good horror story. There is some gore, but not so much that you get overwhelmed. The jokes are funny, but they don’t make the story feel like a parody of something else. It was well thought out, and I cannot wait to see where it is going to go next.”
“Artist Ryan Mendoza brings a level of detail to the story that perfectly compliments the writing style. It fits the spooky storytelling by adding shadow to hide monsters, and the detail in the backgrounds make you want to spend time on each panel.” 
“The monsters are very Lovecraftian. … Because they have that Lovecraftian feel to them, the monsters really are both written and drawn in a way that affected my Lizard Brain.” Read the full review
"...so many tentacles..."
The Pullbox called it “the bastard lovechild of John Hughes & H.P. Lovecraft.” (We’re pretty sure they meant that in a metaphorical way, because if that’s literal, well… ewww.) 
Here’s more from Paul’s review: “It brings a mismatched group of high schoolers together, throwing them against evil the likes of which you’d find in a dusty tome full of impossible to pronounce names. The beauty is in the execution. Despite some pretty heavy themes -- mounting madness, eternal torment, human sacrifice -- Mike Shea’s story stays fairly tongue in cheek. [Artist Ryan Mendoza] knows how to get his Lovecraft on. So many tentacles…” Read the full review
Miskatonic High #1-6 will be available as a collected edition and issue 1 has been approved and will soon be available digitally on Comixology. So they think it’s pretty good, too.
Before you back Miskatonic High, check out some of the rewards we have to offer. We offer shipping to anywhere in the world, but shipping costs are separate from the reward costs.

Stretch goals
We've completed two stretch goals and are working on our third:

Help us unlock this reward by sharing this Kickstarter with a friend or classmate who likes fun comics  or Lovecraft-style horror and ask them to give us a try. Just send them  this link: http://kck.st/2VBd3db 
Of course. Here’s the first few pages of Miskatonic High #1 so you can see if you like it.
Stick with us as through the six-issue first season, Alex, Matt, Sarah, Simon and Ren will travel through time to come face to face with Abdul Alhazred and his Necronomicon, descend into the darkest pits under the earth, and learn what is really going on in the public library when no one is looking.
So please join us for the fun!
We’re raising funds to pay for a small print run for our Kickstarter backers and the old one lurking down in the basement. But comics are expensive to make. Printers, the Postal Service and shipping supplies will be taking most of what we raise. Kickstarter takes their percentage, as does payment processing. If anything is left over, we might go nuts on McDonald’s Dollar Menu!
Is that an existential question, because we haven’t gotten that far in AP English Lit yet. 
Yes, there are two guys working hard to bring Miskatonic High to life. The comic was written and lettered by Mike Shea and drawn and colored by Ryan Mendoza. We’d say more about ourselves, but we’re actually really busy putting the finishing touches on issue 6, the last issue in Season 1! 
So you can feel comfortable getting invested in Miskatonic High, because you’re sure to find out the answers to what is really going on!
Additionally, you can follow Miskatonic High on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Plus there's a Miskatonic High website where you can sign up to our mailing list for the latest updates.
Add-ons
We've gotten some questions about add-ons, and they're a little confusing (mainly to us, but it doesn't take much to confuse us), so here's the simple explanation. The only add-ons we have at this time is:
An extra copy of our standard issue 1. Each additional copy costs $5.
An extra copy of our 8.5" x 11" print from the second stretch goal. Each additional print costs $2.
In order to buy them, simply go to the top where it says "Manage your pledge." It'll take you to the level you pledged. In the pledge amount box, just add $5 for each additional copy you want and/or $2 for each additional print.
After the campaign ends, you will receive our survey, which will tell you that you have extra money to “spend” on add-ons. You just need to let us know how many extra issues/prints you want then (according to the tutorial that I found on Google which is hopefully not even older than the box of baking soda in my fridge...wait, I never put a box of baking soda in my fridge!). 
That's simple, right? If you have any additional questions, just let me know.
Attribution
"Hey guys, who did that amazing music in your video?" 
Glad you asked, it's a track called Wizard by Jahzzar, which is available on the Free Music Archive. We edited the track to fit our video.

campaign.story:
Ninety Years of Classic San Diego Tiki, 1928-2018
Celebrating San Diego’s Polynesian Pop Culture, Tiki Restaurants, Bars and Cuisine
Full-color 8"x10" softcover edition, 200 pages, March 2019. ISBN 978-1-732816-4-04
About this Project
The book started out as a general story about how families, restaurants and bars have contributed to the cultural history of San Diego. After several years of research, I realized I had waaaay too much material for merely one book, so I separated out the tiki section as its own story...
Ninety Years of Classic San Diego Tiki will feature a foreword by Sven A Kirsten.
Ninety Years of Classic San Diego Tiki not only encompasses the history of these Polynesian Pop wonders, but also includes biographies of the people who were instrumental in their success. You'll find a fascinating collection of stories, ephemera, long-lost photos, urban archeological finds, and even some recipes!
Profusely illustrated with ephemera, archival photos, and even some tiki food & drink recipes!
 Tiki Makes a Great Gift!
Pre-order the book for that favorite tikiphile in your life. This Gift Notice is available for backers to print out, and to put under the tree!
High-res printable PDF available for Backers! (Not a coupon or voucher, just a card...)
Bradley’s Puka-Puka (1937-1970) menu offered 150 varieties of rum. Oh to try a Myer’s Mona 1906 Jamaican—it was 30 years old back then!
Little Red Hen
Publishing a book is an expensive proposition. As an independent author, I have no affiliations with learning institutions, nor sponsoring publishers. In fact, publishers I've spoken with said the book had to be an art book, or a cookbook, or a pop culture book, or a straight history. It could never be all of these things. Well, I say yes it can. And it is. 
As that famous little red hen used to say, “I’ll do it myself...” But with your help!
Ohana Love
All the hard work is finished, but I’m now facing a $24,000 investment for acquiring the publication rights to archival photos, printing, warehousing, fulfillment, shipping costs and their associated expenses. By pre-ordering Classic San Diego Tiki on Kickstarter, you’ll help get this project off the ground.
Please check out the backer rewards and help make it possible to bring this book to you and yours! 
Mahalo,
Martin ‘Martiki’ Lindsay
"Tiki Mugs of San Diego," a limited edition collector's poster, is available individually or with the book.
This one-of-a-kind 1939 photo album from Santa Catalina Island is part of the Maui Patron backer reward.

About the Author
Martin S. Lindsay, AIGA, is an art director, local historian and freelance writer from San Diego, California. He blogs about history and food. Martin was a contributor to Tim Ferriss’ bestseller The 4-Hour Chef, and is author of the upcoming book, 90 Years of Classic San Diego Tiki. He has over 35 years experience in branding and design. His design firm serves the San Diego arts community, foodservice and restaurant industries.

Thank you one and all - this project is finally coming to fruition!  
While you may think nothing's been happening for a while, it has been in reality quite a busy time! The text has been locked down by my editor, scolding me, "no more changes!" Final proofs are approved, printing art is at the printer in Hong Kong, and deposit (your money) wired. We selected Great Wall Printing Company Limited, in Chai Wan, Hong Kong, for their long track record of producing quality art books for publishers such as Insight Editions.

Hello all, 
I'm very pleased to announce the digital version of "Ninety Years of Classic San Diego Tiki" will be available for download to ALL BACKERS that have ordered digital or softcover versions very soon via Apple Books (iOS, OSX),   Shopify (EPUB), and Adobe Digital Editions eBook (EPUB),  and possibly Google Play whenever they get back to me... 
We're busy converting the final print version to digital and setting up the downloads. Fun, fact: Did you know some fonts are not embeddable in digital versions of books? Their creators see this as an unauthorized "transferral of software," and so do not have the correct "embed permissions" activated. (Yeah, let's just re-format the text in 224 fixed-layout pages...)

campaign.story:
Heat Experience is a technology meets outdoors gear start-up based in Trondheim, Norway. We specialise in battery heated clothing and our products are designed to be able to go from suburban shovelling to summit skiing, all designed by outdoor enthusiasts who don't like being cold. 
The company, having started-up in 2016, now has five Core Series products on offer and we are excited to be launching our Core Series Heated Gloves here on Kickstarter for you in the US!
When it comes to cold and sometimes painful hands in winter... If our hands our freezing and our gloves are letting us down, then we know yours are too. We decided to do something about it.This really is the end of frosty fingers.  
For the Kickstarter price of $99, all backers will receive, before Christmas, one pair of gloves, two batteries, a charger and can add on our custom Beeswax Leather Care, which works to nourish the durable sheepskin palm, and can also be used on the fabric enhance the s water repellency. We also have a car charger as well.
The Core Series Heated Gloves are made with high quality, durable fabrics with a water repellant coating and 3M™ Thinsulate™ insulation which surrounds the carbon fiber heating elements. The heating elements cover the top of the hand and extend to the tip of every finger for encompassing warmth. With each battery giving up to five hours of heat per charge and with three levels of heat to choose from, and touchscreen-friendly fingertips - this is a serious upgrade to even a great pair of gloves. They confidently back their product up with a two-year warranty.
 The Core Series Heated Glove has been created to tackle the harsh Norwegian winters we here at Heat Experience grew up and still adventure in. By utilizing the most modern technology and materials available, and with solid, sleek Scandinavian design backing them, these gloves take having technology in your hand to a practical and higher level. 
The Heat Experience team are outdoor enthusiasts, and a tight-knit group focused on bringing to market products that not only fulfill the gaps in the winter gear they had, and to a quality level Scandinavians expect, but also incorporating ideas their customers have brought up.  From the city of Trondheim, Norway to your hometown, we wish you a warm and active winter!
Warmest Regards from Emil, Jennifer, Rasmus and Fredrik. 
If you have any questions or want to order more than one pair without backing multiple times, don't hesitate to contact us:

campaign.story:
5/8 UPDATE: Check out the add-ons below! All rewards now available as add-ons, get them while the getting is good!
Hello there fine folks and cocktail lovers of kickstarter. My name is Blair Reynolds, the founder of BG Reynolds Syrups, and I'm bringing back some of the most sought after ingredients for tiki and tropical drinks of times past.
BG Reynolds is proud to be bringing back more crucial tiki cocktail ingredients back from the dead! The new lineup of Gardenia Mix, Honey Mix, and Tropical Red "Fassionola" will unlock hundreds of new cocktails to tantalize your tastebuds! No more messing around with housemade recipes and burnt batches, trust BG Reynolds to bring you the best cocktail ingredients using all natural ingredients!
Note: Bottles sent through kickstarter will be 375ml/12.7oz.
Stay up to date with rewards, polls, and any corrections on BG Reynolds Kickstarter Updates Page!
Gardenia Mix: A long lost secret ingredient formulated by Donn Beach, and used for his intensely delicious Pearl Diver. This rich, spicy blend of creamy coconut, luscious honey, fragrant cinnamon and even more spices will find its way into your every day mixology! Great in coffee with a splash of rum for a Coffee Grog too! (note to the deep tiki nerds, the original recipe calls for dairy, but for my lactose intolerant libation lovers, I went with coconut, which adds silky texture and the lightest hint of real coconut, it's so good!). 
Honey Mix: Not just any old honey, BG Reynolds has painstakingly sourced real California Orange Blossom honey, once used by Donn Beach for dozens of his delicious cocktails. This unique honey varietal provides a bright, citrusy flavor that not only sweetens but enhances the flavor of every tipple it touches.
Tropical Red "Fassionola" syrup: A vivid red syrup once used by many a tiki bar for adding intense tropical flavor to Hurricanes, Zombies, and Punches. It's been recreated by many a home bartender, and now BG Reynolds brings it to your retail shelf! This all natural syrup is full of tangy passion fruit, tart cherry, and a whole host of tropical flavors!
BG Reynolds will be bringing this lineup to life late summer 2018, and we need your help to kickstart the project! Labels, bottles, and all that research getting everything just right can really rack up the bills. Your preorder lets us get through the launch with smooth sailing! Plus we get to give out all these super cool rewards and kickstarter exclusive items we've been saving just for you! Be sure to check out the Add-Ons towards the bottom of the page!
AWESOME REWARDS!
Kickstarter Exclusive Recipe Booklet
BG Reynolds Kickstarter exclusive recipe booklet - A full list of home bartending tips, tricks and 24 new & classic recipes by BG Reynolds and a few of his friends for using your new BG Reynolds mixes. The printed version comes in full color glossy print with spiral binding, perfect for sitting on your bartop to make the recipes!
Devil's Reef launch party - Come mix and mingle with your fellow kickstarterers at Tacoma's own Devil's Reef! There will be a warm welcome for all attending, and a special menu of drinks featuring the new lineup! If your pledge level comes with the invite but are unable to attend, we can offer an additional 375ml syrup from BG Reynolds lineup instead. Event will be September 2018, final date TBD.
BG Reynolds Mai Tai glass with gold highlights
BG Reynolds Mai Tai glass  - Everybody needs a Mai Tai glass or two in their lives! The gorgeous BG Reynolds pattern print by artist Tony Canepa will wrap around the rugged Double Old-Fashioned glass, dishwasher safe and BG Reynolds approved! We're sure you'll fill it with many a Mai Tai (and whatever other concoctions you create) for years to come!
BG Reynolds tiki mug concept sketch, final design TBD
BG Reynolds Tiki Mug in LIMITED EDITION KICKSTARTER GLAZE - Standing in tribute to the premier tropical ingredients maker, this mug of BG Reynolds will stand proudly behind your home bar, making sure your jigger pours are on point, and subtly suggesting new flavor combinations to try. We hear its subtle powers can even make your cocktails tastier and your ingredients last longer! That's just what we've heard, anyway. This will be your only chance to get our exclusive kickstarter glaze before it goes to regular release! Color poll coming in an early update. Standard Chestnut glaze available as an add-on for $30, see add-ons section below. Original mug art by Dave Stolte, mug by Munktiki Imports.
BG Reynolds Hawaiian Shirt
BG Reynolds Hawaiian Shirt - Why keep your drink mixing pride behind the bar? Wear something that says loudly "I Freaking love great tiki drinks" with this custom, limited run Hawaiian shirt! featuring the BG Reynolds pattern print by Tony Canepa. 
ADD-ONS!
You asked for it, you've got add-ons! You can add additional items to your pledge level by simply choosing the item(s) you would like and then following the instructions below to add to your pledge!
All these awesome add-ons!
ADD-ON INSTRUCTIONS: To add an add-on to your pledge, follow these steps:
Press the 'Manage Your Pledge' Button above. If you have not pledged yet, it will say 'Back this Project'
Increase your pledge in the 'Pledge Amount' box by the total of the add-ons you want to add. Send a message to us as well, as a heads up while we're tallying the numbers.
After the end of the kickstarter campaign you will receive a survey that will ask you questions so that you can explain how you would like the add-on money assigned.
A BIG MAHALO TO MY FRIENDS AND FAMILY
First, to my lovely wife Sara and our three children who have to deal with Daddy locking himself in the basement to work on getting this kickstarter started!
Jason Alexander and Robyn Murphy of Devil's Reef for hosting our launch party and helping me out with recipes and inspiration.
Dave Stolte, whose mug design keeps me laughing every time I look at it.
Tony Canepa, whose awesome artwork is sure to be a part of tiki culture for years to come
Jonathan Chaffin of Horror in Clay, who walked me through setting up this kickstarter. 
All the wonderful folks at BG Reynolds Tiki Bar for taking a gander at my previews and helping me make this kickstarter awesome!
FOR MORE BG REYNOLDS
Check us out on
BG Reynolds website
Facebook
Instagram
BG Reynolds Tiki Bar Facebook Group (fresh topics daily, and BG Reynolds LIVE streaming every Thursday at 6pm Pacfic)
BG Reynolds kickstarter updates page, for any error corrections or explanations, polls, and updates!
Cheers to you all! I can't wait to get your rewards out!
FAQ
Q: Why do the bottle pictures say 25.4 oz (750ml), but you're only offering 375ml?
A: Because I am only so talented at Photoshop. BG Reynolds will be launching 750ml versions depending on demand by our on-premise accounts.
Q: Are your syrups shelf-stable?
A: Yes, each are good up to a year to two years from production, and are stamped with a 'Best By" date.
Q: How do I preserve the syrups after opening?
A: Refrigerate and use within 90 days, or splash in ½ oz of Vodka for preservation.
Q: Why are you launching this on kickstarter if you're an established brand?
A: Because it's fun, and there are rewards!
Q: Why don't you ship to my country?
A: Because I had no idea I had customers in your country, my apologies! Once these are in production, we will be shipping internationally through BGReynolds.com
Q: Will these syrups work without alcohol?
A: Most definitely! As a sweetener in your coffee, or a non-alcoholic punch. We'll be sure to include a few teetotaler safe recipes in the booklet!
Q: What is the kickstarter exclusive glaze for the mug? Standard?
A: The kickstarter exclusive glaze will be up for vote in a kickstarter update. Standard glaze will be a majestic chestnut brown.
Q: What do you mean by create a custom syrup?
A: You will present a recipe or request BG Reynolds develop a recipe based on your standards, and BG Reynolds will send samples, develop the labels, and prepare your syrups for bottling! Once bottled, how you want to use or sell it is up to you.

updates.update_userinfo: It's... it'll never be done, will it? Some lessons learned.
updates.update_content:
A bit of a rant below, but I want to make sure you know how much I love and appreciate you all for backing this kickstarter. It was quite the experiment for me!
But a package smashed during delivery, or ghosted into the atmosphere; the custom shirt debacle from not creating the right button; one dude who won't send me his address so I can't fulfill the reward; a backend system that won't successfully mark fulfilled orders as fulfilled because they're stuck in processing... 
Here we are nearly a year later, and I'm still working on the debacle that this kickstarter became. And who do I have to blame for it? Myself. So many lessons learned, a few of which I'll share with you now.

Hi Folks,
if anyone ordered a custom sized shirt, it looks like the data didn't cross over right. It's always something!
If you have not received your shirt, or received a shirt that was not the requested fit, please e-mail orders@bgreynolds.com with your size info and order confirmation.

campaign.story:
The Secret Voice Volume One
What Is The Secret Voice??
Doctor Galapagos, a goggled, bandaged mystery man is just one of many agents of the ineffable Red College that we meet in the pages of The Secret Voice. Doctor Galapagos is our hero, our mystic battle man on the spot. He seems wildly capable of facing any and all hand to hand combatants. But Dr.G isn't just battling hundreds of angry trolls or brigands all at once, he's also fighting an unseen, unknown, psychic menace. He's finding his grip on reality becoming more and more tenuous, just when he needs it the most.
The tyrannical warlord known as The Smog Emperor has made his way through the previously impassable mountain range known as the Great Mountain Shelf.  His forces pass like wildfire through a mostly peaceful region, subjugating the people and laying ecological waste to the lands he conquers. Can the Red College and the allied forces of the land turn the tide? Can Dr. Galapagos keep his cool, stay true to himself, hold on to his love, and defeat the Smog Emperor all at once?
The Secret Voice is my own personal version of an epic fantasy saga. Because I'm me, it's a trippy, sometimes discursive affair that's just as focused on the sense of space and atmosphere as it is on the big picture plot stuff. This is me pouring all my love of adventure & fantasy narratives, artcomics, manga, and eurocomics into one misshapen container. It's about a big olde fashioned land war driven by the invasion of a despot; it's about a bunch of weird psychic warrior monks; it's about wild kung fu magic battles; it's about monsters and supernatural beings. But it's also about someone in over their head and not being honest with themselves or the people they love, and figuring out how to own their mistakes.
Along the way there are brigands, underground kingdoms, cities under siege, mass warfare, kung fu, psychic battles, talking animals, ghosts, and more monsters than you can shake a stick at–and that's just in the first book!
The Book
I've been working on The Secret Voice off and on for a while now–in that time it's run as a webcomic, been published with other material as a series of comic books, and now I'm ready to collect the first big chunk of it into the first of three graphic novels. 
Volume One collects the Secret Voice material from issues #1-3 with newly remastered color and art in early chapters, as well as an additional 30+ pages of new comics and a section of backmatter and pin ups from some of my favorite artists. It's going to be flipping awesome!
Remastered art from issue #1
The book we're looking to make is 160 full color 8.5x11" pages, packed to the brim with comics and art. The base tier of funding we're asking for is $12,000, which is enough to make a beautiful softcover book with some spot varnish on the cover and nice paper inside. If we can hit $15,000, everyone gets a fancy hardcover book.
As I mentioned above, the book doesn't just have a ton of wild comics in it, it also has supplemental production art from the various stages of working on the story, a map of the Secret Voice world, and pin up illustrations by some of my favorite artists working today: Farel Dalrymple (The Wrenchies), François Vigneault (Titan), Michel Fiffe (Copra), Sammy Harkham (Crickets), and Simon Roy (Prophet) have all contributed images for the pin-up section!
 The Rewards
If you look to the right there, you'll see a list of rewards and reward configurations. We tried to come up with every possible combination of rewards, so check that out closely for the exact tier that best suits your needs. Here's the various pieces of the puzzle:
 Exclusive Enamel Pin & Embroidered Patch
A cool embroidered patch with an exploding troll head, and a Kickstarter-exclusive severed troll arm enamel pin can be yours! 
(If you want to combine a patch and/or pin with a tier that doesn't already include one, just pledge that item's amount more than the tier, and when the Kickstarter is over, there will be an exit survey allowing you to note which ones you paid for) 
Digital PDFs
A high resolution DRM free PDF of The Secret Voice Volume 1 delivered straight to your email door.
Bookplate Editions
A limited number of illustrated bookplate editions signed by the author will be available. 
Early Bird Pricing
Save money & get a free bookplate edition ( with a design that is exclusive to Early Birds) by being one of the first backers!
Silkscreen Print Bundles
Get the book and a beautiful 8x10" silkscreened Secret Voice print!
Retailer Tiers
Are you a comics retailer? Have your own shop and want multiple copies to sell? Maybe some key Study Group Comics titles as well? We got you, at a wild discount (50% on The Secret Voice book & something like 80% on those older titles)!
Sketch Edition
The book plus a nice ink drawing on thick 8"x10" paper. Subject negotiable, within reason, but I reserve final say on what I draw.
 Original Art Editions
The book plus one page of original Secret Voice art of your choice! First come first serve. 
The Money
The money, where does it all go, you ask?
Well, if we're printing 2,000 copies of the book in softcover then about $9,600 goes to basic printing and freight costs. Another $1,000 goes to production costs for the book designer and color assists. Kickstarter takes about $930, and the rewards like the prints, bookplates and patches eat up the rest. It's a pretty tight ship.
The Stretch
Stretch Goals! You gotta have em.  Why? BECAUSE WE GOT FULLY FUNDED in just over a week!
GOAL #1: if we hit $15,000, the book becomes a fancy hardcover instead of a semi-fancy softcover.  
LET'S DO THIS!
GOAL #2 ANNOUNCED: KESHI SET!!
Well, as we leave stretch goal #1 in the dust and head into our final week of the Kickstarter (! Yep it ends this Wednesday), I figure we might as unveil one more stretch goal on this bad boy. Honestly, we could add a dust jacket or a sewn in bookmark ribbon or something but I feel like that would be gilding the Lilly. This book is already going to be awesome. Why don’t we do something a little different? Do you remember M.U.S.C.L.E. Figures? Those little squishy rubber wrestlers many of us played with as a kid? I was in love with them! They had so many different imaginative designs, it seemed like a literal universe of wild characters. And I’ve always wanted to make my own.
Well, when we hit the $18,000 mark that will unlock STRETCH GOAL #2: The Three Piece Keshi Set! (Keshi is what that style of toy is called in Japan, where they originated)
Sculpted and cast by master Keshi Maker Eric Nilla ( http://ericnilla.storenvy.com/ ), the set will contain three 2” rubber figures: Doctor Galapagos, a Troll Warrior, and The Creep. The images here are just for reference, the final designs may vary slightly. Eric does great work with the sculpting and casting and he will translate these designs into something that makes perfect sense as a classic style Keshi figure. The Keshi set will probably have to be sold for more than this after the Kickstarter, but for all of you awesome peoples I’m going to price it at a flat $30.
So I’m going to assume that we are going to hit the 18k mark and just open up pre-orders for the set now. There will be a tier that’s just the Keshi Set + shipping added to the reward options. If you want to add the Keshi set to any of the reward tiers that have already got shipping factored in to the pledges, DON’T change your reward tier. You can actually just adjust your pledge upwards by $30 with no change in shipping. If you just got the digital tier, you can add $36 to your pledge to cover the Keshi Set + shipping, that should be enough. If you want to take this time to add a patch and or pin to your order, now is the time to add on those dollar amounts as well!
When the Kickstarter is all over, I will be sending out surveys so everyone can confirm which add ons they paid for, no need to send me a note now, just fill out your exit survey next week!
Ok, stay awesome! I’m stoked about this rubbery reward!
Let's Do This!
Please spread the word on social media, and check out the reward tiers. See which one fits your needs and PLEDGE EARLY! The sooner we hit our goals, the sooner we can consider our stretch goals!
Thank you so much for taking the time to read this, and thank you for your support.
-Z
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Honestly, there's not much in the way of risks here. We're currently finalizing the designs for the book so we can send it to the printer as soon as this Kickstarter ends. All the new work and revisions of old work are all done. I've successfully fulfilled an even more complicated KS before this, and even if I hadn't, I'm planning to use a Kickstarter fulfillment service for shipping.

The only potential issues that could pop up are with the printer being overseas, sometimes the shipping can take an extra minute, but we're giving ourselves enough time that that should not be an issue except in the most extreme situation.

My goal is to have the books in hand this fall for convention season, and packages shipped out before the book debuts at any shows I might attend.

I've been self-publishing Secret Voice for the last several years under the Study Group Comics label, but for the collection I'll be partnering up with my friends at Floating World Comics. Floating World is both an amazing shop and an excellent comics publisher. Which is good, because not only am I ready to print Volume One, but I've also already got 100+ pages of Volume Two penciled, and I'm raring to get started on that as soon as this book is made!

"Chester & Grace: The Adirondack Murder" is the first in a new series of true crime graphic novels that will tell the stories of the 20th Century's "classic" murder cases.

campaign.story:
Is Snoring Ruining Your Life?
Are you ready for the comfortable, convenient, and inexpensive solution?
Snorelax stops snoring before it can happen by providing jaw support keeping your airway open so you can breathe easy. It’s so comfortable, you won't even notice it.
With Snorelax, you'll wake up feeling better. Your partner will wake up happy. And you won't become a snoring statistic (1 in 4 couples sleep apart and snoring is the #3 cause of divorce in the U.S.) 
65 years of combined medical experience went into creating Snorelax. Our founding Medical Doctors created the perfect way to wake up refreshed. Every morning. Their revolutionary design is patent pending.
The Buzz
How We're Different (It's Comfortable!)
What you've tried before vs. Snorelax
Snoring solutions abound. So what makes Snorelax different?
Comfortable - Snorelax are easy to apply and comfortable to wear – and they're quick and painless to remove. No pulling your beard, no sticky adhesive on your skin. It’s the most comfortable solution on the market today.
Non-invasive -From mouth guards to tongue suction devices, invasive snoring solutions are everywhere. Snorelax is gently applied to the face, not in your mouth or up your nose so there is nothing to fall out during the night. It also doesn’t hurt. 
Helps you Breathe - Not all solutions are created equal. Snorelax not only stops your snoring, but improves your breathing during sleep.  (Exploding pillow anyone?)
Beard Friendly!
Wear Snorelax, comfortably, with or without a beard.  They won't pull your facial hair and stay on all-night while wearing them.  Watch our brief video below, about applying Snorelax, wearing them with a beard, and removing them.

PLAY

With or without a beard, Snorelax stays on all-night comfortably
Easy-to-Use
Snorelax comes with a scored backing which makes it easy to peel and apply. The graphic indicators make placement easy and it's organic shape fits perfectly to the contour of your face.
Snorelax is easy and painless to apply
PLAY

Why Snorelax?
Did you know you’re not alone? 64% of people say that their partner snores. Like many snoring sufferers, you and your partner may have tried some crazy gadgets, chin straps, nose plugs, and mouth-guards.
Snorelax are different. They’re non-invasive, comfortable and effective from the moment you apply them. You can move your mouth freely, but when you relax they hold your jaw in place. You can sleep in any position you like, and Snorelax stay on all-night long.
Improve Your Health, for Good!
We spend one-third of our lives sleeping. How we sleep impacts our health. Snorelax improves the way you breathe so you can sleep better.
According to Harvard Medical School* snoring can actually lead to death.
Stroke, Heart Attack, and Dementia can be related to snoring and airway obstruction.  Even the non-fatal consequences are nothing to mess around with: headaches, low sex drive, obesity, anxiety, depression and more.
Snorelax are easy-to-use and can greatly improve your health and quality of life. We’ve designed them to be high quality,yet inexpensive, so everyone can afford to improve their health.
Save your Relationship
If you’re the partner of someone who snores, you won’t be surprised to find out that snoring is the #3 cause of Divorce in the U.S. It goes beyond annoying, it’s disruptive and causes 1 out of 4 couples to sleep apart.
We’re here to help. Your partner will stop snoring and you'll love the quiet. Plus, check out our reward packages for the deep sleep mask and the meditation cards. It’s a way for you and your partner to reconnect and relax together. Bring on the bliss.
Wake Up with Energy
  There isn’t enough coffee in the world to make up for a bad night’s sleep. Snoring leaves you exhausted and sluggish. With Snorelax you’ll wake up in the morning feeling happier, more refreshed, and ready to tackle the day.
How it Works
Snoring is more than just noise. The noise is annoying and stops you and your partner from getting the restful sleep you need. But, when you snore, a lot of other bad things are happening inside of you.
If you snore, it means you’re not getting enough air. When you sleep your muscles relax and your jaw drops back, obstructing your airway. The abnormal airflow causes turbulence and vibration which is heard as snoring.
Typical snorer with airway obstructed
If you are a snorer, your heart, brain and other vital organs are not getting the air they need. Snoring is our body’s siren indicating that something is terribly wrong; don’t ignore it!
Snorelax doesn’t just stop the sound of snoring, it solves the problem. Snorelax comfortably supports your jaw so you can breathe better and sleep in any position. They improve your sleep quality and enhance your next day's performance. Snorelax gently adheres to your skin and is beard friendly.
Snorelax provides support to keep your airway open and sleep silent
Our Technology
Snorelax utilizes a unique patent-pending technology to eliminate snoring. Years of research and testing went into the development of Snorelax. (Our team has tried dozens of other “snoring solutions” over the years, only to leave them under the sink collecting dust). The result of all of our work is a rigorously tested product that gives instant snoring relief.
Share Snorelax
Our rewards are designed to improve your health and relationship and thank you for your support. 

Whether or not you can financially contribute to our campaign, one of the best ways to support us is through social sharing.  Please share Snorelax with your friends and network by clicking on any of the links below.


Let's Talk About Rewards
We've created several rewards for all to enjoy.  Whether you are buying for yourself, your partner, or as a gift - our rewards will fit almost any need. If you have a specific request, please message us.  Our team is standing by to help.
Please message us if you need a custom reward or specific requests
When Will We Ship?
We’re excited to announce that ALL ORDERS will begin shipping within 2 months from the end of this campaign. When you back this project, you’ll be provided with shipping rates for your home country. We are headquartered in the United States. Please note that if you live outside of the U.S., you may be responsible for local duties, fees, and taxes. 
Our Story
Snorelax fulfills the personal quest of our founding team of Medical Doctors to end snoring.
Unhappy with existing treatments and products, they decided to create their own solution for snoring.
It had to be comfortable, easy to use and produce fast results. All at an affordable price.
Along the way, they gave prototypes and samples to their friends to test. People kept asking for more, saying it was saving their marriages and improving their quality of life.
Years of innovation and testing later, Snorelax was perfected.
Our founders refined their prototypes to the Snorelax you see today: soft yet strong; slim yet stable; comfortable yet effective in eliminating snoring.
Kickstarter will enable us to reach the minimum order quantity required and produce the first commercial run of Snorelax. We need your help. 
Timeline
We’ve self-funded the technology, design, development, and testing for Snorelax. Every dollar pledged will go towards manufacturing, quality assurance, and packaging. 
Comfortable and no grip loss with a beard.


FAQ
We're standing by to answer your questions, but here are some of the most common inquiries we receive:
I have facial hair.  Will Snorelax still work?
Yes!  Snorelax works on all faces, with or without facial hair.  We do not recommend using Snorelax if your facial hair is longer than 1 inch, but rest assured that our R&D is aggressively working on creating a version intended for long facial hair.
Does it pull on the skin...is that what it's doing?
Definitely NOT.  Snorelax adhesive is created with sensitive skin in mind, as not made with natural rubber latex.  Snorelax adheres to the skin, comfortably, and keeps your jaw from dropping when your muscles relax.  Your skin will not feel pull or tightening when wearing Snorelax.  Our adhesive is intended for long term wear.
Do you have other colors?
We sure do.  Snorelax comes in Midnight Black and Tan.  Who knows, we might even be able to offer Snorelax in clear!
Does it work for both men and women?
Absolutely!  Snorelax works on anyone.
Will Snorelax work if I have been diagnosed with Sleep Apnea?
Snorelax does not cure or treat Sleep Apnea.  Snorelax improves breathing by preventing obstruction from your jaw dropping.  Please consult your physician for Sleep Apnea treatments.
* https://www.health.harvard.edu/blog/snored-to-death-the-symptoms-and-dangers-of-untreated-sleep-apnea-2017021311159

Track our project on Kicktraq!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Snorelax isn't some far-fetched idea pieced together in a garage. We're a growing startup, self-funded, and have developed patent-pending technology to create a powerful product, with lots of exciting momentum.

We've finalized our design, aligned our manufacturing requirements, and have done our necessary steps with getting our FDA Class 1 Exemption classification. Our tools and molds have been created and ready to produce Snorelax for everyone to enjoy. We've reduced many of the risks startups face.

However, as with any newly manufactured product, it's possible for unexpected events to impact the actual production time frame. On the positive end of the spectrum, our manufacturing and logistics process is ready to go - we anticipate that Snorelax will deliver to our backers earlier than expected.

Our commitment to all of you is that we will make every effort to deliver you an exceptional product, on time, and will communicate with you regularly along our journey of getting Snorelax delivered to you, so you can sleep better, breathe better and be better. Let's bring on the quiet, together!

campaign.story:
What makes a hitman different from a serial killer?
Ghost Assassin is the tale of hitman-for-hire, David. David isn't like other hitmen. He has the ability to see and interact with ghosts. David has no compunction about killing. To him, being dead is more natural than being alive. Unfortunately those he has killed do not see it the same way.
How can David's conscious ever be clean when the sins of his crimes literally haunt him?
The goal of this Kickstarter is to raise funds for the printing of issue #1 of the new Ghost Assassin ongoing series.  The first issue of Ghost Assassin is print ready.  All artwork, coloring, lettering and graphic design for the first issue are complete.  Issue #1 is a 32 page full color comic written by Adam Watson with artwork by Joel Cotejar and Charles Carvalho with coloring by Edward Bola and Gulliver Silva.  The cover for issue #1 is penciled by Joel Cotejar with coloring by Ceci De La Cruz.
This is the first time that this series will be presented in a full length ongoing format.  The 10 page "Prelude" story will be represented as a back up tale in Ghost Assassin #1 with new lettering.  This Kickstarter is an opportunity to do a soft relaunch of Ghost Assassin in an ongoing format, the way that it was originally intended to be.  Ghost Assassin is a character driven tale that incorporates elements of the crime, suspense and supernatural genres.
 Any surplus raised by this campaign will go towards finishing the production of issue #2.  Issue #2 is a 32 page full color comic that features the stories "In The Cards" and "Origin".  Issue #2 is written by Adam Watson with artwork by Joel Cotejar, colored by Ceci De La Cruz and inked by Mario Zimprich.  In The Cards features a plot by Michael Colbert.  All pages in issue #2 are penciled, all but 13 pages are colored.
Issue #3 has been fully penciled and is currently awaiting the coloring stage.  Issue #3 is a 32 page full color comic and features the story "The Dig".
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risks with this project are extremely minor because the files are print ready. However there are always risks of delays due to printer error, files not transferring correctly, etc... I have built a great relationship with my printer and have worked with them for over 7 years. We do not anticipate any delays but I am confident that if any arise my printer will work effectively with me in order to overcome them quickly and efficiently.

updates.update_userinfo: Chronicles of Van Helsing: Blood Will Out Now On Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Blood  Will Out is a horror western tale set in the Chronicles of Van Helsing  world.  It stars Jeanie Marie, matriarch of the Van Helsing clan (and  hero of issue one), as a young girl.  Following a string of cattle  mutilations, Jeanie’s father, brothers, and local ranchers form a party  to find out who has been feeding on their cattle.  They fear the source  to be supernatural.  Jeanie, frustrated at being left behind and  compelled by dreams and visions, sneaks out of her house and into the  woods, armed with an old rifle and a machete.
Soon  she encounters a pair of shape shifting were-creatures, and is forced  to do battle against a much stronger foe.  Meanwhile, the hunting party  has tracked a larger band of the creatures into an underground cavern,  and is now trapped and outnumbered.

updates.update_userinfo: Offset Problems and a Potential Solution
updates.update_content:
I am extremely sorry for the lack of updates.  I have hit a few snags with the offset printing of issue #1.  The printer that I originally placed the order with, Edward Brothers, had some issues with the large black areas of the book.  I redesigned the pages in question but unfortunately the problems did not stop there.  In June I got a message stating that they were closing their doors and my order would not be fulfilled.  Luckily I had not put any money down on the order.
Printer problems are something that I try my best to work contingencies in for, so I put in an order with my secondary choice.  Unfortunately I did put money down on that order and after several months of waiting and being given false promises of delivery it seems that they are not going to fulfill the order.  I am currently in the process of disputing the credit card transaction for this order and as soon as I have the money back I will be placing an order with an offset company called G&H.  I currently do not have a time estimate for how long the credit card dispute will take but I will not give up on getting an offset print run of this issue completed.

I am sorry for the lateness of this update.  There has been a slight delay in the production of the offset printing of issue #1.  The heavy black areas of the book were problematic for my printer because they cause smudging and can potential smear black onto adjoining pages.  The inside of the front cover and page #21 were particularly problematic but the gutter areas could have also caused issues.  I have spent the past several weeks correcting all of the gutter areas and doing something different with the interior of the front cover (the indicia page) and page #21 (the page that introduces the Prelude story).  I do not anticipate any further delays as these were all of the problematic areas.  I am very sorry for the delay.  I should have the books in hand in approximately 2 weeks.

campaign.story:
THE HAUNTED SWORDSMAN
From Kevin McTurk, the director of the award-winning Kickstarter funded short film The Mill at Calder's End, comes a gothic horror adventure told with groundbreaking puppetry and innovative practical effects.
The Haunted Swordsman is a live action samurai tale set in a world of demons and ghosts that will utilize 36 inch tall bunraku puppets, traditional in-camera effects and good old-fashioned smoke and mirrors trickery. 
Director Kevin McTurk and Lead Puppeteer Eli Presser lining up the first camera test of the Samurai.
 This short film is only a single chapter in an epic tale of a lone samurai and his odd guide, the cursed severed head of another samurai, as they traverse a world of mythical creatures and nightmares of folklore...
The Haunted Swordsman. Sculpture by Arjen Tuiten
  The Navigator. Sculpture by Arjen Tuiten.
  The daughter of the Shogun, raised as a warrior, heir to the realm after her father's brutal murder. Forced into hiding, the Princess will reemerge leading a formidable band of loyal warriors in an effort to help the Samurai defeat the Demon Overlord.
    'Lost in a bamboo forest, his Shogun murdered by an evil supernatural force, a lone samurai collapses to his knees with an anguished cry. Disgraced and humiliated at having failed to save his Master, the Samurai prepares to commit seppuku. But a voice stops him. A voice emanating from a cursed severed head who offers to guide the Samurai on a quest for vengeance. Thus begins the tale of...'The Haunted Swordsman'.
The first chapter of THE HAUNTED SWORDSMAN , THE SWORD OF WHISPERING DEATH, will be a stand alone tale. However, with each Kickstarter stretch goal that is reached , a new continuing chapter in the epic tale will be unlocked and will be able to be filmed.  
 For each new short film chapter, director Kevin McTurk will bring together his team of professional puppeteers, camera and lighting technicians, top creature effects artists, amazing voice talent and phenomenal sound designers and musicians, to create a visually captivating tale of revenge, honor, love, and betrayal.
As each short film chapter is unlocked,  a new reward bonus item (yet to be announced) will be sent to EVERYONE that contributes at the DVD/Blu-ray level (or higher)!  Each of these items will be announced as a milestone is approached.
In addition, new exclusive gifts (designed by a group of phenomenal film concept artists) will be announced at each milestone. Each new gift will be offered as a separate reward package or can be an ADD ON to your original order. 
      A RETURN TO KICKSTARTER
 I am absolutely thrilled to be returning to Kickstarter. In 2013, I set out to make The Mill at Calder's End and created a Kickstarter campaign to raise $32,000. The campaign was a fantastic success and I raised over $65,000.
The Mil at Calder's End was an official selection at over 60 film festivals worldwide and won 14 awards, including the 2015 Grand Jury Prize for Best Animated Short at the Seattle International Film Festival. In addition, I was honored to have Guillermo del Toro purchase the Grimshaw puppet for his personal Bleak House collection. 
The puppet was also personally selected by Guillermo for the traveling museum exhibition At Home With Monsters, which premiered here in Los Angeles at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art (LACMA), and continued on to Minneapolis Institute of Art and then on to the Toronto Art Gallery of Ontario (AGO).
REVIEWS OF MY EARLIER GHOST STORY PUPPET FILMS
"THE MILL AT CALDER'S END IS TOLD WITH A PASSIONATE SENSE OF STORYTELLING IN A MEDIUM THAT BOTH ENSHRINES AND REINVENTS THE OLD CLASSICS." -Guillermo del Toro (Pan's Labyrinth, The Shape of Water, Hellboy)
"BREATHTAKING...AN INNOVATIVE AND ENGAGING USE OF PUPPETRY..." -Sir Richard Taylor, Weta Workshop (The Hobbit, Lord of the Rings)
"CREEPY...FILLED WITH SOME REALLY COOL HORROR IMAGES... I CAN'T WAIT TO SEE THIS..." -Rick Baker, Special Make-Up Effects Artist, Winner of Seven Academy Awards
"HAUNTING AND ATMOSPHERIC...IT IS VERY RARE THESE DAYS THAT YOU SEE AN ORIGINAL STORYTELLING FORMAT, ESPECIALLY ONE THAT SUITS THE SUBJECT MATTER SO WELL..." -Mike Mignola, Creator of Hellboy, Contributing Artist for "The Mill at Calder's End"
BACKGROUND
The Haunted Swordsman is a passion project that is heavily influenced by the films of Akira Kurosawa, the Lone Wolf and Cub manga and film series, the classic Japanese ghost story films Kwaidan, Ugetsu, and Kuroneko, among others, as well as visceral, immersive films like The Revenant and Mad Max: Fury Road. 
I have always had a great love of puppetry and traditional in-camera special effects. The work of Jim Henson (The Dark Crystal, Labyrinth, and his Storyteller television series) is a great inspiration to me and I am hoping to bring his sense of wonderment and artistry to The Haunted Swordsman.
In 2012, I was honored to work with Heather Henson (Jim's youngest daughter) on my first film. Heather produced The Narrative of Victor Karloch as one of the short films for her Handmade Puppet Dreams Film Series and was a guiding force in helping me create the haunted world of Victor Karloch.
THE FILMMAKING APPROACH
The Haunted Swordsman will be told with the traditional Japanese theater puppetry technique known as bunraku. Each puppet figure is controlled by three (or more) puppeteers dressed in black and hidden behind each character. It is my goal to make a film that celebrates practical effects and therefore there will be very little computer generated imagery in the final film. In my first film, The Narrative of Victor Karloch, I utilized several silent film era camera techniques, such as a shot of a miniature ship on a stormswept ocean (which, in fact, was made up of painted flowing garbage bags). For The Mill at Calder's End, the Apparition (see below) was puppeteered in a water tank.  I plan to continue to use many more of these 'old school' techniques to give a hand crafted look to The Haunted Swordsman.
From my experience working as a special effects artist in Hollywood for over twenty years, I have been fortunate to work with the most talented creature effects artists,concept artists, and puppeteers in the industry.
This film celebrates two of my great loves: the art of puppetry and suspenseful storytelling. I promise that The Haunted Swordsman will be unlike any puppet film you have ever seen before.
The Apparition puppet (voiced by Barbara Steele) filmed in a water tank for THE MILL AT CALDER'S END.
  Preparing a pre-dawn location model shot of the windmill for THE MILL AT CALDER'S END.
    Production Stills from THE MILL AT CALDER'S END. A combination of practical sets, greenscreen composite shots, miniatures (including a Model T on a converted exercise treadmill), and the full size "Bramblegore" creature.
  For THE HAUNTED SWORDSMAN. Lead sculptor Arjen Tuiten (Wonder, Pan's Labyrinth) details the severed head of the Navigator character. This will be the full size insert version for the animatronic head.
  ABOUT THE FILMMAKERS
Kevin McTurk | Director
A professional creature effects artist, cinematographer, model maker, and puppeteer, Kevin McTurk has been working in the effects industry for over 20 years. In 1992 he began his career in special make-up effects at Stan Winston Studios, working on Batman Returns, Interview with a Vampire, and the Jurassic Park films. He has worked for many effects companies over the years, including the Jim Henson Creature Shop, Amalgamated Dynamics, Spectral Motion, New Deal Studio, and Weta Workshop in New Zealand. His most recent credits include The Dark Crystal: Age of Resistance and Stranger Things. In 2011, Kevin completed his first puppet short film, a Jim Henson Foundation grant project, The Narrative of Victor Karloch. The film was a great success, playing in over twenty international festivals, and winning the 2012 BEST ANIMATED FILM at the DragonCon Film Festival. His follow-up film, The Mill at Calder's End was the result of a highly successful Kickstarter campaign and played in festivals around the world. This film won many awards including the Grand Jury Award for BEST ANIMATED SHORT at the Seattle International Film Festival.
Tab Murphy | Screenwriter
 Tab attended USC Film School and has been a working screenwriter since 1983. His major breakthrough came with a writing credit on Gorillas in the Mist, for which he received an Academy Award nomination. Tab wrote a number of Disney feature animation movies including Hunchback of Notre Dame,  Tarzan,  Atlantis: the Lost Empire, and Brother Bear, which was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Animated Feature. In addition to his Disney credits, Tab has written several Warner Bros DC animated movies, including  Batman/Superman: Apocalypse and Batman: Year One, based on the Frank Miller graphic novel.
Guy Davis | Production Designer
Guy is a Conceptual Designer and Storyboard Artist for film, television, and video games. His work can be seen in the Guillermo del Toro projects Crimson Peak, Pacific Rim, The Strain, Pinocchio, and the upcoming film, The Shape of Water. Guy has also contributed concept art for The Mill at Calder's End, Paranorman, Steven Universe, Gears of War 4, Evolve, The Simpsons: Tree House of Horror XXIV, and the Mystery Science Theater 3000 revival. He is also an Eisner winning comic book artist and the creator and illustrator of The Marquis (published by Dark Horse Comics).
Arjen Tuiten | Lead Puppet Sculptor
Accomplished Dutch sculptor and make-up artist, Arjen Tuiten has worked for Stan Winston Studio / Legacy Effects, DDT, and Rick Baker's Cinovation Studio. One of his greatest make-up contributions is the Pale Man character for Guillermo del Toro's masterpiece Pan's Labyrinth. He has now founded his own studio R-E-N and is responsible for the make-up effects for the films Rings and Wonder.
Paul Komoda | Puppet Sculptor
Paul Komoda is an artist whose dark dreams are manifest through sculpture and illustration. He's worked in the fields of film and collectibles, and for a time, had worked directly with the legendary surrealist, H.R. Giger. He is expanding into realms of graphic storytelling and fine art.
Mitch Devane | Puppet Sculptor
Mitch Devane is one of Hollywood's top sculptors who has contributed his artistry to many films including Bram Stoker's Dracula, The Ring, and Hellboy 2: The Golden Army, among others.
Eli Presser | Puppeteer
Extraordinary marionette puppeteer and creature suit performer, Eli Presser is a CalArts graduate in Puppetry Arts. Eli lead the team of puppeteers on The Mill at Calder's End. Eli currently serves as the Technical Coordinator for the Performing Arts Program at the Los Angeles Museum of Natural History.
Peter Abrahamson | Mechanical Designer
A skilled animatronic designer, Peter Abrahamson has been working in the film industry for over 20 years as a puppeteer, robot builder, and animatronics creator for such projects as Hellboy, Men In Black 2, BattleBots, and the Jim Henson TV show Dinosaurs.
Luke Khanlian | Mechanical Designer
Luke Khanlian is a Design Engineer who spent most of the 90's working as a mechanical designer and puppeteer on film and television projects including: Starship Troopers, Bicentennial Man and The Green Mile.
Tim Gore | Puppet and Prop Painter
Master painter Tim Gore has over twenty five years of experience in the make-up effects industry and has worked on many iconic films over the years including The Lost World: Jurassic Park 2, Hellboy, Lady in the Water, and Hellboy 2: The Golden Army .
Miyo Nakamura | Sculptor and Painter
Accomplished sculptor and painter Miyo Nakamura has worked on the films X-Men: First Class and The Thing (among others) for Amalgamated Dynamics as well as many giant sculptural pieces for Blizzard at Alliance Studio.
Spectral Motion | Associate Producer, Creature Design Consultants
Mike Elizalde’s Spectral Motion is one of Hollywood’s premiere creature-effects shops, making monsters for films such as Stranger Things, Hellboy, Hellboy 2:The Golden Army, and Pacific Rim.
Will Thomas | Composer
Will Thomas, a composer & producer based in Los Angeles, has released four albums under his minimal electronic moniker Plumbline as well as four albums under his song based project Dive Index. These have included collaborations with ambient innovator Roger Eno, as well as Joseph Arthur, Merz, Mark Gardener (Ride) and Ian Masters (Pale Saints) among others. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges

THE HAUNTED SWORDSMAN will definitely be a challenging filmmaking experience. Every frame of this film is essentially an effects shot. The "actors" of this film are the sculpted puppet characters that are controlled by three puppeteers dressed in black (or green screen) behind each puppet. Therefore, one of the single greatest challenges is how to film the puppets and hide the puppeteers from camera. There will definitely be a number of shots that will require "rotoscoping" ( digitally erasing puppeteers from the shot, frame by frame). In addition, every element of the puppet world - wardrobe, props, and sets - must be custom built for the film.

In terms of production scheduling, "THE HAUNTED SWORDSMAN : SHORT FILM ONE" should be completed within a 6-8 month time frame.The shooting schedule could possibly be delayed if puppeteers and/or technical crew members are unavailable on shoot days due to better paying jobs or out of town work and would therefore force us to reschedule. But the ultimate goal is to start shooting this fall and reach post production in the spring/early summer..

How will the Kickstarter money be spent?

Here is a short breakdown of the budget: 
30% Puppet Construction,Costuming,Sets,and Props 
30% Cast, Camera/Lighting/Stage Rental/ Crew 
20% Post Production (Sound Mixing/Digital Compositing/Color Correction)
20% Kickstarter Rewards and Shipping

updates.update_userinfo: THE HAUNTED SWORDSMAN screening at The Egyptian Theater (Hollywood) on 2/21
updates.update_content:
THE HAUNTED SWORDSMAN will be screening before the Japanese classic ghost story film KWAIDAN on the giant screen in Hollywood at the historic Egyptian Theater! 
Here are the details: http://americancinemathequecalendar.com/content/kwaidan-0
This will be an incredible night! The Egyptian is a gorgeous historic theater (where Ridley Scott premiered Alien in 1979!) and I am thrilled to show the film before a 35mm print of the ghost anthology KWAIDAN (which heavily inspired my short film)..Tickets will go fast - I hope to see you there!

campaign.story:
In the 1st Volume of The Chronicles of FARO, we embarked on a 200 page adventure through time that culminated with the crashing of the Lincoln Assassination. 
We move on to Volume 2, which will open with a very different 1976 and an America that has expanded far beyond Manifest Destiny on it's 200th birthday.
The survival of Lincoln has led to a century of prosperity, but a dark cloud of evil looms in the distance, evolving every day before the eventual convergence of consequences.
 Volume 2 -- Chapter 1 will be a 36 page adventure that will take Faro from the Mississippi River and across the Southwest before touching down in San Francisco for a deadly showdown with Master Wu, who is still seething for revenge since the murder of his true love, the sadistic and seductive Domina Palms.
 With another time machine being built, Faro must choose between the future and the present when his lover Rachel Rain is taken by THE CIRCLE, the cult of trillionaire time travelers who have been stalking Faro since the beginning of this adventure.
As our story continues in a world we can only call American History on Acid, the FARO Series will take your imagination beyond the borders and into new possibilities of story and seduction.
As always Faro Comics not only brings you the best stories, we have the best artists, who bring the ultimate mature mashups to life. 
 Our current print series REIGN of MARVELS constantly sell right out of our gallery. Choose any prints you want with our numerous packages. 
 My goal as a comic book writer is to write for the big boys, but I've been accused of being "too pushy" and "out there" with my ideas each time I get in front of them.  
I always told them I'm not going away, and with your continued support as readers and collectors we continue to be a tiny thorn in the face of corporate comic cliffhanger complacency.
Join the Faro Comics Universe, where the readers get to help create the new posters with your passionate and perverse feedback.
I tell everyone I meet that FARO is the greatest adventure story ever written.  So if you want the chance to call me an arrogant asshole then pick up a copy and tell me I'm wrong.
 I have a body of scars, and scars of bodies in my wake from 20 years of working in the industry of rare and exotic art acquisitions.
It has been the greatest and most stressful moments that make for the true nature of the stories you will read from us.
I hope you love reading it as much as I love writing it.
Thanks for making it this far and always remember,
It doesn't matter where you're going,
It doesn't matter where you've been, 
All that matters
is now.....

campaign.story:
When you think about “Science,” what comes to mind?
At Monkey Minion Press, when we think about “Science,” it’s always capitalized. To us, “Science” is more than a word - it’s a big idea or a burning question. Science is a way of thinking about the world and ferreting out it’s secrets.
But how do you write a small book about something so huge?
We realized that what most excited us about Science were the stories. The true-life tales about answered questions and discoveries, the “Ah-Ha” moment when everything came together...
The “EUREKA” moment.
Science is full of amazing stories about huge discoveries by great characters and we want to tell these stories in the only way we know how: through clear, accessible prose and beautiful, graphic art.
“EUREKA” is more than an art book with a Science theme. “EUREKA” is  about some of the stories and characters we find so compelling. Albert Einstein and his imagination. Galileo and the Tower of Pisa. Grace Hopper and the first computer bug.
“EUREKA” will be written and drawn by Dane Ault and Ashlie Hammond, who have been writing, drawing and publishing kid’s books for years under the name Monkey Minion Press. This is our first Kickstarter.
Why Kickstarter? 
We’ve been publishing books, greeting cards, and posters under the Monkey Minion Press banner for years. But of all of our projects, “EUREKA” is the biggest challenge.
We want “EUREKA” to be a celebration of Science and scientists, and it will be, but we also want to make a book that reflects our excitement about Science in general. We want a hard-bound, beautifully off-set printed book that will hold up to many re-reads and flip-throughs, and look great doing it.
However, high quality, hard-cover, full-color books are expensive to produce, so we need your help to make this project happen.
What kind of book will I get?
“EUREKA” will be at least 44 full-color pages of hard cover Science goodness. We plan to print our books through Regent Publishing because we know what they can do. (They printed our friend Cody Vrosh’s books and they are beautiful.)
We want “EUREKA” to be a case-bound hard cover book with a full-color printed and laminated cover. The interior paper is a medium-weight gloss paper with full color offset printing. This book is going to look great on the shelf and feel better in the hand.
Writing and Sample Page Layout
What kind of prints will I get?
A preview of a few of the Giclees.
We’re printing the 6”x6” Giclees through a local Portland printshop called ColorHausPDX. We’ve worked with them extensively in the past and know that these guys can deliver high-quality, beautiful work. 
The art prints will be 6”x6” giclee-printed on heavy 100% Cotton Rag photo quality paper using high-quality archival inks. These giclees will look nice and bright on your wall and they won’t fade or yellow over time.
Rewards
SHIPPING
In the US, we'll be shipping your books USPS Priority Mail so we can track  each package. If your package comes to you damaged or fails to arrive, let us know and we'll do everything in our power to make it right.
Posters will be shipped separately to avoid damage. We'll ship them USPS 1st Class Parcel Post in a very sturdy cardboard tube. In the past, we've used this tube extensively to ship art for MMP with good results.
Outside of the US, we'll ship your rewards USPS 1st Class Parcel Post.
ADD ONS 
STRETCH GOALS
This project is all about "EUREKA," and so our stretch goal plans are mostly improvements to the book. We'd love to add new scientists and more pages. Dane dreams of printed endpapers and bookplates. Watch for updates to get more specific information when we get closer to our goal!
If you made it this far
Thank you so much. Your support means everything to us. Really.
If, like us, you are excited about Science and want "EUREKA" to become a real book, please share this with your friends, family, enemies, casual acquaintances, and people on the street.

As with any book, most of the risks in hitting our projected delivery time involves shipping or printing delays. 

All of the artwork for the book (save any stretch goals) is done, and the writing is well on it's way. The peripheral products (poster, giclees, postcard, etc.) are all pretty well designed. Since we are printing them locally, delivery of those items *shouldn't* be a problem.

The project!
My name is Ben Collison. I am an artist who has studied traditional drawing and painting but that's not why I am here today. I am here to self publish the unusual style I have developed in cafes throughout San Francisco. The recipe for my style is that I use coffee and ink to make art. First I draw with ink then in a risky primitive way I dip my finger in coffee then I smear, smudge and splatter it until the image is complete. I have created over 200 images, 100 illustrations and 100 textures that are ready to be combined into a 100 page hard cover book. The illustrations are sensual and gritty, only the way coffee and ink can create. The imagery resembles classic sepia tone photography. The subjects of this body of work are strong females inspired by classic 70's rock stars. Each page is filled with passion and intensity that is rarely collected in print. campaign.story:
Edie Ellen Poe lives here with Raven, her vampire cat.
Edie and Raven's hobbies include:
teddy bear head transplants
running a ring of cat-burglars
not returning library books
taking over the world
Edie hopes to star in her own moving storybook series. 
Stories! That talk! And move! 
Wanna know something interesting? This pilot episode was filmed and sound-recorded largely on cell phones. (Therefore, it is but a taste of the glorious world domination that is to come!)
Here's the Pilot Episode!
Your Mission, Should You Choose to Accept It: Season 1
So. This moving (and talking) storybook series is created by Martha Hull. That's me. I'm totally responsible for this whole thang. You love it; you hate it - either way, you can blame me.
If we fund this thing, I'm gonna finish writing, make the art for, and do the sound and video editing for Season 1 of of Edie Ellen Poe, consisting of six episodes MINIMUM. Plus, a Kickstarter-exclusive PIxar-esque bloopers mini-episode. That's right! A special super-secret mini-episode just for you, because that's how much I love you. 
These Might Be Episodes:
The Little Girl Who Lives in the Cemetery  
The Pied Kitten of Hamlin  
The Wormhole Ate My Sandwich: an overdue spellbook, a closet, and peanut butter sandwich.
A Very Edie Ellen Poe Halloween Birthday Special  
Home Sweet World Domination Center
Catburglars ‘R Us
The Bat Cave (No, not THAT Bat Cave.)
Poe to Poe; a young Eddie Allan Poe pays a visit.
FrankenEdie
The Dolls on Dead Hill
A Dress with Flowers on It. Origin story. Involves a funeral parlor and a heist.
Here's a Map.
Some More Awesome Things This Series Will Contain:  
Stuff on this map. Stuff NOT on this map (imagination stuff!) Maybe some cows. Also, a skeleton who jumps rope.
Anyone else grow up in dairy country?
WTF is a "moving storybook?"
It's part read-aloud picture book, part voice-acted animation, part stick puppet theater. Everything is better on a stick. You know it's true.
Oh, look! Splatters! The images are hand-painted?! Cool.
Tell me about the Rewards Goodies!
New reward level! Check it out! For a $50 pledge, you will get a special 7" x 9" softcover commemorative book of Teddy Bears, the pilot episode of Edie Ellen Poe. This will be a special edition available through Kickstarter only. All pledge levels $55 and up will get the book automatically!
Necklace: There's gonna be a necklace. In STEEL. Yep.
Prints: Then, there's the Kittens of the Apocalypse!
Just like the one hanging above Edie's bed!
Tell me another reason this is cool.  
I'm a girl (well, I was one when I was really short.) Tim Burton. Edward Gorey. Charles Addams. Neil Gaiman. Not girls. You get it.
Who is this appropriate for?
Do you know this phrase? "They're creepy and they’re kooky, Mysterious and spooky, They’re all together ooky..." It's appropriate for you.
Books What I Made
I have self-published two books. (These are made of good old fashioned "paper.")
Death's Daughter and the Basket of Kittens is a coming of age tale about the Grim Reaper's daughter, Belladonna, and her four death-absorbing kittens: Strife, Pestilence, Famine, and Fluffy. I made this with the help of 190 cool apocalyptic cats who funded my first Kickstarter!  
No kittens are harmed in this book. Everyone else is fair game.
This looks like trouble.
Death. Kittens. Basket. The trifecta.
Untimely Death Alphabet, published in September 2011, is a collection of cautionary tales of small children about to meet their untimely demises, told in pictures in the shapes of letters of the alphabet.
My, what a big cover you have, my dear!
This picture brought to you by the letters Y and F. (They're the shy ones.)
I love print books. But I wanted to see some stories moving around! So - MOVING picture books! Science!
The Money. Really?
Really. 
I put off figuring out how much this was going to cost until the last minute because I knew it was going to scare the sh*t out of me. (My least favorite kind of horror!) It still does. It's a lot for someone's first foray into a new medium. But I thought a season should have at least six and a half episodes. You deserve no less. So here we are.
Labor Costs
These Kickstarter funds would make the it possible for me to make a full season of Edie Ellen Poe. Basically, you are hiring an extremely small production company. Named Martha. My salaried rates are fantastic. I love eating beans and working weekends.
Supplies
I need a non-shitty video camera for the puppetry sequences. My phone kinda worked for this pilot, but... let's face it, this pilot episode is not going to make it onto an iMax screen. 
I also need microphones for Edie (whose voice lives in a different time zone from me) plus Raven t (whose Transylvanian accent is slaughtered by yours truly.) Plus more pixel real estate (AKA hard drives).
Prizes! I mean, rewards!
Gotta make 'em. Gotta ship 'em. You deserve no less.
Uncle Sam.
Auntie Oregon.
Kickstarter. They take a cut. You knew that, right? It's substantial (8.5-ish% of it all) but without them, you and I would be meeting in that back alley behind the pizza shop. The one that smells like dog poo? 
Let the diabolical fun begin!
Apocalyptic, maniacal love to you!
