campaign.story:
Zompire: The Undead Film Festival takes place October 11-12, 2014, at the Clinton Street Theater in Portland, OR. Our goal is to highlight filmmakers's creative attempts to show the undead in new and unexpected ways. Zompire is ALL independent films. It's clever, innovative, horror filmmaking for intelligent audience members. It all takes place in an awesome neighborhood movie theater. If you love movies, we think it's the most fun you can have in October. 
Coming to the festival? You can get ticket packages with exclusive T-shirts, lapel pins, pendants, shot glasses, and more by pledging at one of the "ATTEND" reward levels. If you just want a ticket, but no exclusive merchandise, you can click here to buy plain tickets.
Whether you can come to the festival or not, we have some awesome rewards you can take advantage of, while supporting the wonderful world of Independent horror.
Our Occult researchers have decoded the strange words inscribed on the Legendre sigil. These are names of 10 infamous directors... er, necromancers, who have assaulted the world with Undead menaces. (This is an homage to some of our favorite filmmakers.)
STRETCH GOALS
STRETCH GOAL $4,000 – The official Pre-Party will be Thursday, October 9th at the Lovecraft Bar 8-10 pm. If we reach this first stretch goal, we'll also have Undead entertainment by the lovely ladies of the Critical Hit Burlesque troupe, and give a $100 cash prize to costume contest winner.
STRETCH GOAL $5,500 - In order to be successful, filmmakers need to have the resources to make and market their films. Most festivals charge submission fees and just submitting a film to the major film festivals adds up fast for struggling filmmakers. However, most independent films need this kind of exposure to get funding for feature projects or find distribution for their works. Zompire has always been a low budget operation, so we have never had the ability to offer cash prizes that would assist filmmakers where they need it most. If we reach this stretch goal, we will award cash prizes to all 4 of our award categories:
$150 Horde Award - Audience Choice, chosen by blind ballot. 
$150 Le Gran' Zombi - Awarded for overall excellence 
$150 Abby Normal Award - fresh perspective or other innovation
$500 Tombe D'Or - the film that best exemplifies Zompire. 
STRETCH GOAL $9,000 – If we reach this funding goal, we will award the following higher cash prizes to all 4 of our award categories: 
$1,000 Tombe D'Or  - the film that best exemplifies Zompire. 
$300 Horde Award - Audience Choice, chosen by blind ballot.
$300 Le Gran' Zombi - Awarded for overall excellence 
$300 Abby Normal Award - fresh perspective or other innovation
Brian just said, "If you love watching the short blocks at the H.P. Lovecraft Film Festival, you'll love Zompire, even if you think you don't like zombie or vampire movies." It's the same aesthetic: great indie short and feature films coming from student filmmakers, small studios, and everything in between.
The Clinton St. Theater has been a Portland fixture since opening in 1915. They are wonderfully quirky neighborhood theater, devoted to supporting Independent film. Photo courtesy of Dominique Lamssies.
Why a Kickstarter?
Kickstarter is great for getting the word out about niche events like Zompire. These amazing films deserve to be seen by a wider audience of cinephiles, and we're hoping Kickstarter will help us bring them more attention. Over the past couple years, we have put a lot of money into print and online advertising, but traditional media is expensive and has not reached the enthusiastic audience we need to ensure that the festival continues. We need to do something different, so we're turning to Kickstarter.
We have discovered from our H.P. Lovecraft Film Festival & CthulhuCon campaigns, that Kickstarter can bring together an amazing community of fans and can make the festival more fun for you through participation. It's also more fun for us because we can make cool stuff for you, which in turn gives you exclusive keepsakes of a fun weekend, complete with bragging rights!
Putting on a festival is expensive. There are a lot of expenses behind the scenes that really add up. This will be our 3rd Zompire as organizers, and we really want to continue to bring quality independent horror to Portland. Unfortunately, the first two were not very well attended, and the 2013 festival was financially disastrous for us personally. We questioned whether or not we'd be able to continue putting on the event. This year is make or break. 
The final reason is the most important! We have heard through underground sources that the Vampire Wizard, Zappardo, is raising an undead army to raze the City of Portland on the same weekend as the festival. Just like organizing film festivals, defeating undead armies is expensive! Your support will give us the means to produce unique forms of protection and undead domination to thwart Zappardo's evil plans. Help us help you to not die a grisly death at the hands of his vile revenants!
Our exclusive Kickstarter rewards will help you survive the Undead assault! Shown is the Undead Domination Kit etched box, string of beads, mockup of pewter amulet, and T-shirt.
Legendre's Sigil of Undead Mastery - this amulet is a key component of the bayou wizard's power, and is said to have origins as far back as the druids of the Celtic Isles. Passed from hand to hand, from trader to trader across the globe, this symbol takes the form of your choice: either a lapel pin or a pendant. Amulet is 1" in diameter and cast in solid pewter with a red highlight, courtesy of Arkham Bazaar - Lovecraftian novelties and other oddities, and Queen Penguin Productions.
T-shirt, Work Shirt, Hoody - features the ancient Sigil described above, printed in red and white by Sigh Co. Graphics, purveyors of unique apparel and accessories. The full sigil is also encircled by the mystical names of 10 of the most powerful Necromancers from the Colonies to Italy, and beyond. These powerful wizards have unleashed some of the most notorious Undead on the world, including the Pittsburgh zombie outbreak of 1968, the opening of a gate of Hell near New Orleans, the Vampire epidemic on the streets of London in 1931, and more. Only available to Kickstarter backers, these will not be for sale later. 
The Undead Domination Kit comes in a hinged wood box, etched with the Legendre Sigil of Undead Mastery.
Undead Domination Kit - Everything you need to ward off OR control the Undead is contained in this hinged storage box etched with the Sigil of Undead Mastery to protect your valuable tools from les morts-vivants. This is a replica of the original box, found among the possessions of Pierre Lafitte.
Zombie Control Powder (for creating or controlling your own undead minion)
Essential Saltes (call upon your own pocket advisor!)
Coffin Nails (use to place a hex on your enemies, or to break the spells of necromancers working against you.)
Sacred Candles (focus your powers. also an essential source of light during your ritual!)
Reliquary containing the bone of an ancient sorcerer to help channel your undead mastery (random sorcerer included in each box!)
Chalk and charcoal (for drawing summoning and protective symbols. non-toxic!)
String of 13 sacred rudraksha beads on a red cord (can be used to confuse Hindu Vetalas and their European counterparts, vampires! It is well known that blood drinkers must count each bead before they can feed on your life force; a fact Catholics exploited to ward off vampires with their rosaries!)
Replica documents and journal notes detailing the uses of each item, as well as an index of sigils useful for control, protection, and hexing against the undead.
Legendre's Sigil of Undead Mastery pin or pendant
Why is Independent Film so important? 
Independent filmmakers are the ones who take real risks, making movies with truly fresh ideas. The films shown at Zompire are not your father's zombie and vampire flicks. You won't see the same tired premises from the last 100+ years of horror cinema. This is all new from the twisted brains of today's brightest and hardest working storytellers, without the constraints of box office figures or committee movie making. Without independent filmmakers, Hollywood would have no one to steal great ideas from. This Halloween season, you could spend all your time watching reruns of classic horror films in theaters and on TV, but why not enjoy these fantastic films you've never seen before, and may not have the chance to see again? Please join us and support the vitally important genre of independent horror cinema.
You'll also be supporting independent theaters! Portland is blessed with several historic, independently-run movie theaters that offer an alternative to the homogenous re-makes and dumbed down fare that Hollywood provides. Most independent and family-run theaters are constantly on the verge of closing down. Whether you come to our film festival or not, attending other festivals and seeing films in these smaller venues keeps alive an important outlet for independent film. Without these establishments, you'd never be able to see indie films on a 50 foot screen with like-minded patrons of the arts.
The Louisiana origins of the Legendre Sigil and Undead Domination Kit
In the early 1800s, the notorious pirate Jean Lafitte and his charming brother Pierre ran their smuggling business out of a small blacksmith shop in New Orleans. This was a risky business, fraught with danger from not only the authorities, but also from those who perceived they had been cheated or conned by the brothers Lafitte. Death was rampant from Grand Isle and Barataria Bay to New Orleans, and it was whispered that the dead had a way of coming back to extract vengeance. The practical Pierre had engaged the services of a bayou wizard whose dank cabin, covered almost completely in spanish moss, stood hidden deep in the Louisiana swamp near Bayou Saint Denis. This wizard was notorious for his skill in the arts of Necromancy. During a renovation of the famed Blacksmith Shop, an old wooden box was uncovered by one of our associates in New Orleans. After viewing the contents, they knew it would be better to bring the box to us to study, than to let it become lost in the pages of history. We believe this box belonged to Pierre, and its ancient secrets were used by him and his brother to both ward off spectral attacks on hot, still, moonlit nights in Barataria Bay, as well as to fight back with their own newly risen undead minions.
Who is Zappardo?
One of the few confirmed photos of Zappardo and his undead bride. In order to prolong his evil, he slit the throat of his fiancée and sacrificed them both in an unholy rite that brought them back from beyond as bloodthirsty monsters.
His origins are shrouded in mystery, but our sources tell us he is a powerful and ageless vampire, who practices the dark arts of necromancy. He may be the legendary alchemist, the Comte de St. Germaine. Others believe that he is the Roman Centurian, Longinus, cursed with eternal life. Still others say, along with Vlad Tepes, he may be the inspiration for Bram Stoker's Dracula. Did he whisper undead secrets in the ear of John Polidori and share his carnal tales with Sheridan Le Fanu? If you've read this far, then why not?
Your part in our research (The Quiz)
The first person to message us the 10 correct answers will get a Zompire Logo T-shirt in Large or X-Large.
About Zompire: The Undead Film Festival
Zompire was founded by Andrew Migliore in 2006 to showcase filmmakers' attempts to show the Undead in new and creative ways. Like the H.P. Lovecraft Film Festival he founded in 1995, Zompire features amazing independent short films that challenge conventional filmmaking and storytelling. Many great films have premiered or been showcased at Zompire over the years, including The Revenant (2009 premiere preview cut; Directed by D. Kerry Prior), Dellamorte Dellamore (1994), the & Teller short films (directed by Frank Ippolito and Teller of Penn & Teller), and many more.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Whether or not our Kickstarter funds, the show will go on. Zompire will happen this year, at least. If our campaign is successfully funded, production and fulfillment of rewards will begin immediately. In addition to organizing events like this one, we have also been in the screen printing business for 12 years. As such, all T-shirts and apparel items will be produced in house, with the same quality Sigh Co. Graphics shirts are known for. We know what we're doing here, so we don't expect any delays in production. We will also be producing the Undead Domination Kit boxes in house, and have already constructed a prototype, so we know what tasks are involved in its production. The amulet lapel pin/pendant will be cast by a reliable independent creator that we have used for multiple projects, so we have a high degree of confidence that the production of the amulets will go smoothly. One possible danger when it comes to fulfillment stems from the possibility that our campaign may be *too* successful. Since all of the rewards are being produced by independent creators, including ourselves, instead of being mass-produced by large companies overseas, it is possible that a large quantity of orders will slow down fulfillment. If that happens, I'm sure you'll understand that the production of rewards will necessarily take longer. In any event, we expect that all backers who attend the festival will be able to pick up their rewards in person at the show.

We topped the goal, but are still looking to reach our stretch goals! Check them out! They're awesome! 
*************STRETCH GOAL #1: If we raise $5,000, we will print the book with the never before seen trade cover + the eight extra pages of epilogue. Additional pages and cover will be exclusive to the printed version of the book. ************** ACHIEVED
STRETCH GOAL #1.5: If we raise $6000, I will produce the short story ICHABOD'S FIRST KILL from the Retcon #3 reward tier (assuming nobody buys it), with me being killed my Ichabod!  
STRETCH GOAL #2: If we raise of $8,000, we will print the book at OVERSIZED 8x11 with extra heavy weight interior stock and add 10+ pages of exclusive behind the scenes content to Volume #1, including script to final page photos, pinups from other artists, alternate cover sketches, and more! Additional pages will be exclusive to the printed version of the book. 
STRETCH GOAL #3:If we raise over $10,000, then we'll print all the books in OVERSIZED 8x11 HARD COVER!
WHAT IS ICHABOD AND WHY IS IT WORTH YOUR TIME (and support)?
Ichabod Jones is a critically acclaimed, original comic book series that follows the exploits of an insane and fundamentally deranged mental patient that escapes from a maximum security asylum to rid the world of monsters during the apocalypse with the (usually unwelcome) help of the omniscient, impatient, and authoritative voice in his head.
Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter is a project near and dear to my heart. I wrote it in 2010 and Viper picked it up for digital distribution in 2011. 
The project came out digitally in 2012 to great reviews. Here's just a small sample of them:
"...five of five stars, it is awesome and well worth getting...this one is well worth the couple of bucks you will spend. Overall truly fun to read, and extraordinarily well done. I need to go find the physical copy of this comic book so I can add it to my own library."- Comics Forge
"Nohelty does a wonderful job pacing this series, letting the second half of issue 2 take you full steam into Ichabod’s insanity (or maybe reality). There simply is no middle ground. When trapped with other asylum members, both alive and dead, Ichabod devises a way out of entrapment that relies on the literal “intestinal” fortitude of a slayed “monster” to give then a lifeline of hope out of their pit of despair (for the obtuse, he climbs out of trouble using entrails – damn you obtuse and your obtuseness). Issue three becomes even more insane; once outside of entrapment Ichabod and his followers find a deserted wasteland (i.e. welcome to the apocalypse, kids). From here things just get stranger with Dune-like sandworms and a town that seems to be anything but salvation."- Ain't It Cool News
."..I’m glad I got the chance to read Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter. The journey is a strange one but I couldn’t help but be enthralled the entire time." - My Comic Network
"IJ: MH is not just a visually cool-frightening book to look at. It’s pretty mental too." - Buy Indie Comics
WHY DO I NEED YOUR HELP IF I ALREADY HAVE A PUBLISHER?
Because I DON'T. I had a publisher yes, but those days are long past. 
While my ex-publisher was putting out the book electronically, I was ecstatic about the reviews and outpouring of support. But there was always something missing: a print run. 
I'd been trying to set up one ever since I started producing the book. In fact, we produced eight pages of never before seen content just for the trade!
Eventually, I was told that my publisher wouldn't put the print run together unless I funded it myself. I politely asked for them to relinquish the rights back to me so I could explore other venues, which they graciously did. 
Now the book is wholly mine again, and I'm raising money to get this book out there into your hands. Because to me, comics are meant to be felt, touched, and held; not read on a computer screen. 
AND THAT'S WHAT BRINGS ME TO YOU...
I'm not asking for money in order to make a project. I've already made a project. It's finished. But it's a tremendous financial burden to pay everybody associated with the book, which I did. Thousands upon thousands of dollars. And I just don't have more funds to get this book out the door. 
What I need is your help to get the book printed, onto book shelves, to conventions, and into your hands in the way I've always meant it to be viewed. 
It's been my dream since I was a kid to see a comic book in print, and the only way that will happen is with your support. 
SO WHAT'S IN THE BOOK ANYWAY? 
Volume one will bind the first four issues of Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter. 
A WORD ABOUT THE RECONNED REWARD TIERS: 
We know they are high, really high, but getting you into the book as a character isn't a small amount of work. Regardless of the tier, it means redrawing pages that are ALREADY DONE. Remember, Ichabod's been done for years now. It even had an e-book run. 
People have been reading and enjoying it in a very specific way since 2011, and we're changing all of that for you. It also means delays in fulfillment as we rework all the pages. 
It also means paying my artist his page rate for a second time, reworking panels, and whole pages just to fit with the story. 
Long story short, YES we know it's crazy high. YES we know most people wouldn't go for it. 
However, I also know people blow $10,000 on executive producer credits on movies and this is a way cooler.
For the rest of your life you'll be able to pull this book off the shelf and say you took an EXISTING property and the creator changed the entire mythos just for you. 
You can say the creator rewrote, the artist redrew, and the book was reprinted with your face and name instead of what every person's been reading since 2011. 
That's CRAZY AWESOME!!! Way better than some executive producer credit. 
FINALLY: 
For those of you wondering if you should up your donation and get the sketch cards -- here's a taste of what you'll be getting. They are, objectively, awesome! 
THE BUTTONS ARE EQUALLY AMAZING!!! 
 AS IS THE POSTER!!!

campaign.story:
Hello to all the fine folks perusing Kickstarter!
My name is Jordan and I'm a self-published mini-comic creator and sometime printmaker.  On my own I've put together six mini-comics and zines, and contributed work to three small anthology minis.  I've sold minis at Fluke in Athens and Heroes Con in Charlotte.  I'm coming to Kickstarter to ask for some help with a project I'd like to try.  
The backstory: About a year ago I met a really wonderful woman who is originally from Strasbourg, France.  She wants me to travel with her to Strasbourg and the surrounding areas to meet her friends and family.  I would like to turn this adventure into a project. Now, I may not be as technically proficient as Craig Thompson's Carnet de Voyage, but I would like to try something similar: a sketchbook & diary comic detailing my time there: the places we visit, the countryside, her friends, the food, anything!  (Her parents have already decided they are taking me to see some World War 2 sites).   I would like your help in making this book.
Why is this different?  Well, for one I've never traveled outside the United States!  My viewpoint on the piece is one of a person who has read extensively about the world but has seen little of it.  For most of my life I've lived the southeastern US and only recently have I been able to travel to a couple cities elsewhere in the country, mostly for work.  Also, most art projects and comics are about the experience of visiting Paris, other pastoral regions of France, but not much on this northeastern tip of France.  (I'm excited to be so close to the Black Forest, a place that has figured so prominently in Western stories and storytelling). I've been working on my French, but I've only started to learn in this last year, so I imagine there will be some funny and embarrassing times with my attempts at the language.
My goal is this: to create a 20-30 page book of these adventures.  The amount I raise will determine the quality of the book.  I normally work in a DIY, print at a copy shop style, with the occasional screenprinted cover.  I would like to do the screenprinted covers myself, but have these books be more professionally printed.  
That's my pitch!  Thanks for reading, and I appreciate your time and any help you can give!
Jordan

campaign.story:
A Summer to Remember is a novel about a series of events that happened during the summer of 2012. The book starts off with me beginning my summer, and reflecting on the things I have accomplished that year thus far. Also I look towards the future, and make plans on how I am going to accomplish success as far as a job and career is concerned. Ultimately I decide the best thing to do is enjoy my summer, and make any important life decisions once it is over. During the course of the summer though, I meet a girl. We start to hang out and I begin to catch feelings for her. Very much like my life, I put off being in a relationship with her until the end of the summer. Unfortunately she unexpectedly dies before summer’s end, and I am left wondering why this has happened to me. Eventually I come to the conclusion that life is something that cannot be put on hold. It is going to happen whether you want it to or not.
I wrote this book because I was in a dark place emotionally. I had spoken with friends and family, but still was mentally drained by the feelings I held within. I read somewhere on twitter that if you have a lot of suppressed emotions, it is therapeutic to write it out on a piece of paper. I began to think about situations I encountered throughout the course of the summer, and wrote all of them down. As I wrote, I noticed my individual stories began to form one large story. Compiling all of them together, I let my friends and family read it. After doing this I realized what I wrote was no longer just for me. It was for any and every one who was dealing with a situation similar to mine.
My plan is to self-publish my book as an eBook on Amazon.com. With the help of Createspace.com, they have provided me with a variety of resources to put a smooth and professional finish on my work. I am requesting $3000 for a comprehensive edit, interior design of the book, and a professional critique.

The biggest challenge I will have is raising enough money to get a comprehensive edit. I have had multiple friends edit my novel, but I am currently at the point where I need a professional to edit and critique my writing before I can release it to the masses.

campaign.story:
BookCoin has a simple goal: to create a user friendly, fair, and free book trading experience on both web and app platforms built on the concept of coins. Coins are gained by sending out books and are used to buy books from others. The shipping is always paid by the requester and a prepaid shipping label is sent to the sender.
Exclusive BookCoin shirt design!
Our Vision:
We have a vision to make trading books simple for everyone. We wanted to create something that we would use; something that makes it easy to find new books that have been on our wish list and get rid of old books that have been well loved. Books should never be thrown out when others can continue to enjoy their stories for many more years.
What is the money used for?
We are asking for your help in funding the website and app. The money donated will be used for creating and maintaining the site and app. It will also go towards purchasing books for the site. We want to make sure there is a selection of good books that people want to read. Everyone has a different preference of what they like to read, so we want to have all types of books available from the start, whether they be fiction, nonfiction, poetry, history, educational, religious, children’s books, etc!
Though we have experience in programming on web and app platforms, some of the funds will be used to recruit others to help build the site. The goal is to have BookCoin available on the web, for iOS in beta form by early 2015, with an Android app to follow.
What is the "coin" system?
The strength of BookCoin lies in the coin system. Each coin is worth one book; you get a coin for sending a book and use a coin to get a new book. Coins never expire, and books on the catalogue are available on a first come first serve basis, meaning no waiting lists! The coin system promotes a catalogue of quality books. One has the incentive to post books others want because they receive a coin for only the books they send out. Don’t see a book you want right now? Don’t worry: the catalogue is always changing and expanding.
The coin system is unique to any other trading site and provides lots of benefits. Trading using a coin system allows for a large catalogue of books to chose from and provides a safe, fair environment. Shipping is always paid by the requester of the book, and a shipping label is emailed to the sender. Because one cannot purchase more books then they have coins, it ensures that users will spend their coins wisely and also be encouraged to list quality books.
Once a user requests a book, his coin is put into a waiting system. The coin is then transferred to the sender once the book is shipped and marked “received” or after a reasonable time after being shipped.
Is it free and secure?
This website is free to join and all your information will be kept safe and secure! We will never give out any of your information without your consent.
Is BookCoin expandable?
BookCoin will provide an expandable base for a large group of users. The more users there are, the more books that are listed and the better opportunity to find exactly what you are looking for. Books and corresponding coins will initially be offered by the funds raised and coins will be given to supporters of BookCoin to use on books of their choosing.
What experience do we have that will help us implement this project?
Kevin has a BS in Mathematics and a minor in chemistry. He has experience in programming on web platforms, programming for Android, for iOS, and for embedded micro controllers in assembly language and in C. Kevin’s experience as president of the Math Club in college has given him administrative and team leading experience that will benefit this project.
Nicole is a Senior in college working on a BA in English with a concentration in creative writing. She loves books and has a vision for a free, easy to use book trading platform. Nicole has lots of books she wants to trade, but has not found a good, online platform to do so. This is where BookCoin comes in!
What is our vision for BookCoin in the future?
Our vision for the future of BookCoin is to see a great site and app expand into something book lovers use and adore. Our hope is that a successful site and app will allow us to give more coins to dedicated users as we personally upload more books to the catalogue. We may also introduce a BookCoin market for T-Shirts, bookmarks, and notebooks on the website!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The greatest challenge of BookCoin is the initial construction of the site and app. We want to build something expandable and robust from the start. We’ll use the funds raised to assemble a team of specialists in web platforms, database, and apps design to help with the project. Once constructed, there will be nominal operational expenses of maintaining the site. As it expands to a larger number of users, the site will be maintained by donations from users.

About the Kickstarter
As a result of this Kickstarter project, DieGo Comics Publishing will translate and publish DESDEMONA by Italian authors Giuseppe Di Bernardo & Andrea J. Polidori. The series consists of thirteen volumes of 96 black and white pages each. We have already translated the first three volumes - Forgotten Crimes, Children's Crusade, Small Miracles - as well as a special issue titled 'Obsession' that is an introduction to the main series and will be printed as a limited collectors paperback. The complete series of Desdemona comics will be published monthly by September 2014, in electronic format. They will initially be available through DriveThruComics, and later throughout ComiXology too. Your help is needed to help us to bring this awesome Italian heroine to you! This Kickstarter will raise funds for us to pay the members of our crew involved in this project: translators, graphic designers, editors, authors and illustrators, as well as cover shipping costs of the pledges and fund an audio-comic of the same series. Should the project be successful, we're planning to print the full series of Desdemona. Believe us, Desdemona is worth being read!!! 
LonCon3, August 2014
Have in mind that by backing Desdemona's project you aren't just giving someone money, YOU are supporting our dream to create something that we want to see exist in the world!!!
This is an opportunity not only to help us in this project, but also to become acquainted with what we publish. 
Who is Desdemona? 
 For our English-speaking readers who do not yet know - DESDEMONA METUS is the heroine created by the great minds of the Italian writers Andrea J. Polidori and Giuseppe Di Bernardo. She is a true heroine, an authentic figure of hope in our daily lives, who does not have super powers but a gift, the most precious and important gift of all: she knows how to bless the soul of her listeners. Reading the adventures of Desdemona Metus is to immerse yourself in unsolved mysteries, enigmas of the past and secret societies: all set in a grim, urban reality within the Italian city of Florence, where Desdemona lives and works. 
 Florence is beautiful and shimmering yet dirty and dark. It's a city to explore carefully: there are alleys that hide heinous crimes and disturbing mysteries which, like its many gardens, are jealously guarded within ancient walls. Despite its status as a fashion capital, the Florence depicted by Polidori and Di Bernardo is a cruel, dark and medieval city, leaving lasting impressions upon every visitor, whether great or detestable, just as it does with Desdemona.
 Desdemona is the young radio DJ who hosts The Sleepless, a radio show where our heroine gets to know the absurd and mystifying characters of Florence who call into her live broadcast. She is the daughter of Isaiah Metus, a university professor with a troubled past and obscure connections. The two find themselves in constant conflict, as she blames him for her mother’s death: a tragic event that caused the mysterious form of insomnia that plagues Desdemona. 
Read more about Desdemona's thirteen episodes at our website.
So if you want to enjoy DESDEMONA’S intriguing series, by all means spread the news. Tell your friends, your family, even those to whom you owe money! Talk about her! Write about her! Do whatever you can to help raise awareness of Desdemona’s adventures, so that all of us can enjoy the path that leads to the series’ conclusion. Because Giuseppe Di Bernardo is a writer worth reading, and Desdemona is a book worth fighting for.
DESDEMONA paperback exclusive issue will contents an introduction of the series by our publisher, the 30 pages short story 'Obsession', an exclusive interview with the author Giuseppe Di Bernardo, and a series of exclusive drawings showing Desdemona's trip to London.
 More images for Desdemona series:
 Below panels from issue #05 - artwork by Alessandro Scacchia
Desdemona in the Italian news as L'Insonne:
Watch Desdemona TV show pilot
Funding
All the money raised by this project will be used to pay our crew for the work done up till now and towards the future publication of Desdemona. Any funds above and beyond our stated goal will go toward the production of other publications by DieGo Comics Publishing. Most of the pledge rewards offered have already been printed and are in stock and ready to be shipped to you, our backer! Your help is hugely appreciated, and each of our supporters will be honoured by DieGo Comics Publishing with exclusive gifts.
How the money raised by this project will be used:
* 50% for translators, letterer, graphic designer, editors, authors 
* 20 % for the exclusive pledges to be produced for this project (iPhone skins, t-shirts, USB pen-drivers, A4 Prints)
* 20 % for shipping costs
* 8% Kickstarter's fees
* 2% others expenses connected with the project
 We are ready to ship your pledges. 
Some of the pledges you will receive when funding this project:
1. Desdemona limited paperback for Loncon3 event, every copy will be numbered to make it even more a collectors piece. The issue's contents: Desdemona introductory episode 'Obsession', an exclusive interview with the author and few awesome drawing of Desdemona visiting London. 
2. Postcards with artworks by Claudia SGI and Umberto Giampa'
3. Enchantment Agency calendar, 13 exclusive images of Jasmine and Myriam by 13 renowned Italian illustrators. 
 4. The Cold of Hell, a Steampunk short story by Augusto Chiarle with a beautiful cover art by Denise Di Prima
 5. Get both the special Loncon3 issue and first episode of Desdemona Metus as PDFs, ideal for you who cannot attend the London event next month  or who lives abroad.
6. An exclusive Desdemona iPhone skin and USB pen-drive (4GB) that we will produce ONLY if the Kickstarter is successful.
Our Inspiration
We will be bringing to a global audience a new range of highly anticipated publications, from some of the best European voices of fantasy literature and comics. This will be a pivotal year for DieGo Comics Publishing, and the start of many more! In the future, you will see many further releases as we build upon our library of progressive and true-to-heart fantasy literature.
Who are we?
DieGo Comic Publishing is a London-based independent publishing company that started translating the work of Italian authors into English, and is now devoted to discovering new and emerging authors from around the world. Founded in November of 2012, the fledgling company is a cooperative of authors, artists, editors and proofreaders, as well as an innovative graphic designer, who creates the unique graphics of DieGo’s publications. Our names are Giuseppe e Marcella Pennestri, brother and sister founders; Denise Di Prima, our lovely niece, photographer, letterer and graphic designer; Matthew Perryman student and editor; Nigel Borg, student and translator; Giuseppe Di Bernardo, co-author for Desdemona comic books (who you have seen in the video interview at the top); Federico Memola, author for Rourke the Hexbuster and Enchantment Agency comic books; Marco Guadalupi, author of the Dark Rock Chronicles contemporary fantasy novel; Augusto Chiarle, author of The Cold of Hell steampunk story; and all the artists who contributed with their illustrations to shape the stories told in our comics books.
Nobody on the DieGo team draws a salary - all members of our dedicated team work for a portion of the royalties, banking on the success of the various publications we produce.
In its first year of activity, DieGo Comic Publishing has introduced a number of literary and graphic novels by renowned Italian authors, as well as a flagship magazine that takes readers deep into the worlds of fantasy, steampunk and science fiction. Our titles have received great feedback from industry professionals and readers who bought them at the MCM Comic Convention and World Fantasy Convention in late 2013.
Above Giuseppe & Marcella at MCM London Comic Con, October 2014.

Up to this date, DieGo Comic Publishing has released five titles and, although there have been difficulties, we have held to all of our deadlines and obligations, building the foundations for our niche of faithful readers.

Hi all!
Yes, yes, yes we are at the 72nd World Science Fiction Convention in London. Day one was awesome, we were visited by guest from USA, Australia, Scandinavian countries, Germany and even few English ;) All was very enthusiast, we had few sells and our newsletter subscribers has increased. Hi, I'm Daniel de Sosa. I'm an American cartoonist born in the San Fernando Valley, and have been living in London for the past four years. I'm trying to publish the first 5 chapters of my fantasy comic series Oi! Tales of Bardic Fury in a beautiful one-colour manga sized volume. The first five chapters make up the first arc of Oi! and tells a self contained story about the forming of Iron Age Ireland's greatest rock band.


So what's it all about eh?
Oi! is inspired heavily by my passions for rock music, history, and ancient Gaelic culture and mythology. Traditional Irish music and poetry to me is the most beautiful in the world and more people need to know about the cultures great musical history. Iron Age Ireland was a culture controlled by mushroom chewing druids, where music was considered a form of magic, and even had the power to overthrow kings. Druids were like hippy cult leaders and Bards were like rock stars.  The more I researched and learned about ancient Irish society, the more ideas and characters began popping in to my head. I had to create a story in this setting. Soon Oi! was born.
Hurling in the rain

The story begins with Bryan, who has  has recently graduated from the great Academy of Tara, where he spent 12 years training to become a fully fledged bard.
To complete his training, Bryan must pass his final test: a year-long work placement in a tiny fishing village in the north called Oi, that has not been able to afford a town bard for 20 years. Bryan thinks it will be a laid back vacation chugging mead on the beach and laying with peasant daughters. Little does he know how wrong he is.
Here's some of the characters Bryan meets in the town of Oi:
Servius of Sicilia-the sardonic town slave.
Fishbane and dolphin friend, Star Seal is the village druid. He doesn't swim, water just likes to be around him.
 Aideen "The Mean" O'Riada, Star Seal's older daughter, captain of the town hurling team and a savage beast.
Rhiannon O'Riada, Star Seal's youngest daughter, and set to inherit the village ahead of older sister Aideen because she was born with 'selkie hands.'
If this sounds interesting to you you can read the first two chapters FOR FREE online HERE.
I am intensely passionate about these characters and telling their story.
aren't they just adorable?
model sheet and concept art
Why so blue?
The ancient Gaels and Celts loved covering themselves in blue paint made from the woad plant. 
Just imagine of all that blue inky goodness inside.
If you are going to get this this story the way it should be seen, it needs to be printed in woad-coloured ink. I have been printing my comics for the past few years using a risograph machine. Riso-printing gives a unique effect and feel halfway between old offset printing and screen printing. Oi! volume 1 will be printed in riso because I want each page of this book to look and feel like a vintage gig poster.
Examples of finished pages in mono-blue scale.
This all sounds super groovy. What do you need me for?
Though I have already completed the first two chapters of Oi, it has taken 18 months to accomplish. This is because I have only been able to work on the comic in my free time outside a full time job. I write, pencil, ink, shade and letter the comic all by myself. Each page takes an estimate 6-10 hours to complete, depending on the complexity. It is work that I love doing, but I need your support to fund the completion of this comic at something quicker than a snail's pace. If this campaign is successfully funded, I will be able to focus the next 4 months of my time entirely on completing the next three chapters of Oi! Volume One, and bring the rest of the story to you at a much faster rate. I will also be able to get it printed up for you using the gorgeous risographic process, and sent to you in manga-sized book that I guarantee will stand out from anything else on your shelf.
 Additionally, I want to update some of the art in chapter one, which was drawn over a year and a half ago, to match my current style. Quite frankly, I've gotten better at drawing since it was made.
 If you liked the first two chapters so far,and can't wait to see what happens next to Bryan, Servies, Rhiannon, Aideen and Star Seal, even the smallest donation from you will help to make this book happen.
Do I get some kind of reward for backing this project?

Rock out with your harp out. You too will be able to inspire incidents of mass jigging with this amazing sonic device.

My Backwards Burd friends and I have been drawing sloth portraits of visitors to comic conventions in the UK for over two years now. We've sold an estimated 700 sloth drawings to date, including two to Lena Headey and Peter Dinklage from Game of Thrones while they attended the London Film and Comic Con in 2013 . I have drawn a little girl dressed as Bane as a sloth and I have drawn slenderman cosplayers with Judge Dredd helmets as sloths, so you too can be drawn as any sloth you can imagine.

UPDATED: All backers at rewards levels above $20 will receive the Limited Edition Print. We love how it turned out, and we hope you do, too. 
 Greetings, and welcome to the world of Into the Void. This is Joe, and Jim and I are the creators of this all-ages action-adventure book. 
Why Into the Void?
After years of writing low-budget sci-fi/horror films, like "Sand Sharks", I wanted to devote myself to something that I could actually share with my kids. That's when Jim and I decided to revive an old webcomic of his called "Into the Void". From the beginning, the character designs were super-fun. We spent almost 12 months doing some universe-building and outlining the first 12 issues of what (we hope) will be an ongoing series.
Where does the money go?
A very small amount of the money will cover Jim's art materials. While Jim and I both enjoy webcomics, we strongly feel that you just don't get the same experience as you do with a printed book. The majority of the money will be spent printing the first issue of Into the Void. We want to be able to put this book into people's hands so they can enjoy the book. 
We will introduce stretch goals if we meet our fundraising goal that will help with the production of issue #2.
Is this a kid's book?
No. While it's appropriate for all ages, it's not a book for kids. Think Indiana Jones, Doctor Who, or Star Wars (the original series only, please). Into the Void has that same gee-whiz fun feeling.  
Will the book actually get finished?
Into the Void issue #1 is completed and ready to go to the printer just as soon as we hit our goal.
Thank you so much for your consideration!
Follow our progress on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/ITVComic

Wielding only a knife, Rainsford, a big game hunter, is running for his life. He'd begun this hunting trip with high hopes of slaying a dangerous animal. Little did he know, that there is no more dangerous animal than a prey that can think and improvise. Little did he know, that he would be that very prey.
Short Summary
My name is James Mascia, I am an English teacher at a high school in Maryland who is passionate about writing novels and comics for children and teens. I like coming up with new ways to interest young people in reading.  
We are working on a project called "The Most Dangerous Game". Some of you may be familiar with that title as it is the name of a short story penned by Richard Connell in 1924. The story is about a man who gets stranded on an island with a hunter who had grown bored hunting animals and therefore turned to a more challenging prey: human beings. When we are fully funded, we will be creating a version of this story with a science fiction twist to it, in which our main character, Rainsford, will crash on a planet run by a crazed alien who also hunts humans.  
The graphic-novel will be told in the style of a sci-fi thriller, in which the characters are pitted against each other in a fight for survival. It is my hope that by creating this, it will interest young people in some of classic tales.
Your pledge will help get this graphic novel into the hands of students, and will help grow an interest in reading classic stories. With that in mind, what we plan on including inside this book is a teacher's guide, complete with comprehension questions, essay topics and lessons that can be utilized in the classroom.

campaign.story:
HELP ME spread LOVF around the world -- $4150 STRETCH GOAL
LOVF the book has been funded, but I still need your help with the LOVF Book Tour. If this stretch goal of $4150 is met, when LOVF is released, I will follow the course of my previous manic travels, this time on a book tour. I'll give talks, present slideshows, and sign books in NY, DC, LA, SF/Bay Area, Seattle, and Portland. Along the way I will post a daily webcomic tour diary on Facebook about the events, the people I meet on the way, and my memories from the 2012 mania that almost killed me. At the end of the Tour this comics diary will be published as a limited edition, signed and numbered minicomic.
 The LOVF Tour Diary mini has been added to the rewards, as well as a few more tiers to help support this tour. All Pledges at the $50 level or more will receive the Tour Diary for free.
My expenses are pretty bare-bones. I'll be couch surfing, getting cheap flights, dining in when possible, etc; anything to keep the costs down. I'm also not including the Kickstarter fees on this one, because I figure: hey, you're buying me a tour, I can at least pay the tax.
LOVF Book Tour Stretch Goal: ($4150 total)
Travel: $850
Lodging: $300
Food: $500
TOTAL -=> $1650
LOVF is the sketchbook companion of a man literally losing his mind. In one month, following several personal tragedies, I was triple-diagnosed with bipolar mood disorder, PTSD, and crippling arthritis. As a self-professed over-achiever, I made sure things only got worse from there.
With wild energy, promiscuity, criminal activity, and substance abuse, this became a full-blown manic episode... all of it captured by LOVF, my trusty sidekick. Homeless and broke after losing all my stuff to punk rock heroin dealers, I suffered more misfortunes: getting beat up in the street, running from the law, and getting dragged out of a creek and into a mental hospital.
LOVF is a travel journal.
Off my meds I had only the sketchbook for art therapy. I filled it with cartoons, schemes, portraits, quotes, and an illustrated diary of my stumbles from Portland to Brooklyn, DC, LA, San Francisco, Seattle, and back. It’s a psychedelic, Kerouacian meltdown of cross-hatching, spattered marker, crayons, glitter, tape, nail polish, white-out, fingerpainting, rain, wine, stickers, and word balloons.
LOVF is a mirror. 
A bottle of lithium stabilized me and gave me new insights into identity. I cross-hatched and re-cross-hatched, painted in new figures, connected the dots, and reverse-engineered a full narrative from the notes of my three-month manic spree. It's like I found the diary of a homeless, crazy man and turned it into a comic book.
LOVF is a 168-page, full-color, 5.5” x 8.5”, squarebound book.
With Kickstarter support, this one-of-a-kind art book will be counterfeited in multiple copies -- or as they say, "published." Fantagraphics (who put out my most recent book, Couch Tag) will be covering most of LOVF's publication costs. But in these times of strange publishing markets, I paid for the rest with this Kickstarter:
Publishing costs: $1600 (books, finishing , scanning)
Kickstarter and other fees: $250
Shipping: $500 (yikes! it's the sad truth...)
New Markers: $150 (many a pen has made its last mark in LOVF)
TOTAL -=>  $2500
I'll be posting Facebook updates as I finish the drawings for LOVF. If you'd care to follow me I'm "Blue Fuzz" on Facebook.
More about the Rewards
The 32-page mini LOVF New York: Destination Crisis contains material that will be reprinted in the book. But it is an art object unto itself with a three-color silkscreen cover, published by Robyn Chapman at Paper Rocket. Speaking of which, the LOVF Poster will also be printed by Ms. Chapman with three colors on heavy paper, 10"x14," mailed in sturdy poster tubes. This poster was designed from images in the book by Jesse. Signed limited edition of 50.
Please note that the LOVFer is economically priced as a thank you bonus, yet in limited quantity. One per person. The small drawings included will be of random sizes, on random subjects, in random styles. I plan to make all of these at one sitting during one of my hypomanic weeks, so I can't tell you how many drawings you'll get, but they will be done on colored paper with pens, markers, paint, coffee, stickers, paper cutouts, glue, and whatever else seems right. I call this Hypomarkia. (No actually I don't.) All drawings will be suitable for framing, in the 2"x3" to 6"x9" range. (Drawings are not for sale individually -=> only as part of the LOVFer package, priced at $44, because I will be 44 when this book is published.) 
Here's what some people have said about my other books:
Couch Tag
A deeply affecting memoir   -- Comics Bulletin
Beautiful and scary   -- The Comics Journal
...Sucks you totally in and will leave you often nodding in empathy   -- Forbidden Planet
The Night of Your Life
That rare blend of pointed humor and specially brewed whimsy   -- Association of Alternative Newsweeklies
As sure-handedly and lucidly drawn as the subject matter is crooked and curious   -- San Francisco Chronicle
All Rewards are shipped free in the US. Thank you. Right on.

updates.update_content: Hello Friends, I am happy to announce that LOVF the book will debut this July, published by Fantagraphics Books. Here is the cover!

Hello Friends,
I am writing to give you an update on LOVF, the manic sketchbook diary project that you all so generously supported last fall on Kickstarter. Since I am partnering with the esteemed Fantagraophics Books, it works better with their publishing schedule to release the book in spring 2016. But let me assure you: LOVF is on the way, LOVF is building up and getting stronger. The book will be much better for the time invested! These extra months of clarity have helped me to write and process some of the more difficult experiences I had being a homeless crazy man.
Please accept my apologies for not writing sooner. Life has served me even more challenges and upheavals in the last six months, and I'm finding that with my current health I just don't bounce back or adapt to things as easily as I used to. A painful break-up forced me to move cross-country and switch jobs twice -- nothing worth writing a book about, but it was distracting and made it hard to focus on anything else. I also lost my medical insurance, and have been learning to manage my life without mood medications. (Sorry for being so personal here, but I felt I should explain in a little detail why the project is delayed, and my tardy communication about it.)

Hello Friends,
Thank you all so much for your support. I'm happy to say that not only did LOVF the book get funded, but so did the stretch goal of a Book Tour. I'm really looking forward to spreading LOVF and speaking about my manic experience. If I, as an undiagnosed mentally ill teenager 20 years ago, had heard about real manic symptoms my life might have gone a lot different. Sigh. But right now -- I'm got a book to draw! In the meanwhile, here's some information about order fulfillment.

Hello friends,
Thank you all so much for supporting LOVF -- it was funded last week, to my great delight. Before this Kickstarter, I didn't know when (or if ever) I would finish LOVF, and your generous pledges have made that an impending reality. I look forward to taking a couple months off to let my mind unwind and draw.
I have just one stretch goal for this remaining week of the Kickstarter: when LOVF is released, I will follow the course of my previous manic travels, this time on a book tour. Along the way I will post a daily webcomic, and at the end of the tour this comics diary will be published as a limited edition, signed and numbered minicomic. All pledges at the $50 level or more will receive this minicomic for free -- if the Book Tour stretch goal is met.

All of our backers will receive an all-new DRM free PDF edition of the original stories from Ms. Nesbit's THE BOOK OF DRAGONS with spot illustrations taken from our comic book adaptations!
We also have an add-on available for anyone who wants a print of Daniel Govar's beautiful cover: Just add $10 USD to your pledge, and shoot us a message to let us know you want one, too!
There was some sort of red thing sitting under a palm tree, and under it was written "Dragon."
Originally published in 1900, E. Nesbit's THE BOOK OF DRAGONS has been a fondly remembered children's book for several generations. In the hope of recapturing the whimsy and adventure of her original collection, I assembled a team of writers and artists to bring her stories to life for a new century.
With a cover by OFF REGISTRATION cover artist Daniel Govar, and a plethora of talented comic creators from around the world, THE BOOK OF DRAGONS is 120 pages of amazing comics.
The Book of Dragons, Cover 1
Don't just take our word for it. We'll let the work speak for itself.
THE BOOK OF BEASTS, by Scott O. Brown and Amberin Huq, in which Lionel becomes king and accidentally unleashes a Dragon on his new subjects.
UNCLES JAMES, OR THE PURPLE STRANGER, by Ricky-Marcel Pitcher and Kathryn Frizzell, where animals of various sizes, with the help of a Dragon, thwart a conspiracy.
THE DELIVERERS OF THEIR COUNTRY, by Jonathan Clode and Russell Hossain, a story where heroes are not what they seem and the dragon invasion is imminent!
THE ICE DRAGON, OR DO AS YOU'RE TOLD, by Marc Bryant and Mal Jones, a tale of wonders that befell on the evening of the eleventh of December, when they did what they were told not to do.
THE ISLAND OF THE NINE WHIRLPOOLS, by Thatcher Cleveland and Russell Hossain, in which a dragon is defeated with math in a quest for true love.
THE DRAGON TAMER, by Lori Lapormado and John Andrey Portilla, which reveals the great truth of all Dragons.
THE FIERY DRAGON, OR THE HEART OF STONE AND THE HEART OF GOLD by Charles Webb and Mal Jones in which we give you Dragons. In. Space.
And finally, KIND LITTLE EDMUND, OR THE CAVES AND THE COCKATRICE by Shawn Aldridge and Amberin Huq, our final story where Edmund makes a bum deal, unleashing a Dragon where it doesn't belong.
You can read the original stories here for a taste of what's to come in our edition!
We're raising funds to covering printing costs for the book and extras as well as some marketing and backend publishing expenses. 
Thank you! And we look forward to bringing this project to life for you!
Meet the artist and writers:
Bronco Ink publisher and THE BOOK OF DRAGONS editor, A.C. Brown's work has appeared in English translations of Osamu Tezuka's great children's manga Unico and Triton of the Sea, as well as on www.the-only-living-boy.com
Shawn Aldridge--Portland, OR based writer/letterer. Current work includes Vic Boone and GoGetters (MonkeyBrain Comics).
Scott O. Brown, is a Harvey Award winning comics creator from Mobile, AL. His most recent work has appeared in Heavy Metal Magazine and Off Registration.
Marc Bryant is probably best known as the co-creator of Shangri-La from Image Comics and the constant collaborator of the artist Mal Jones.
Thacher Cleveland is currently self-publishing the Winston & Churchill paranormal private investigator short story series, working on several comic projects, and is one of the hosts of the Super-Fly Comics & Games podcast.
Jonathan Clode is a writer from Wales who co-edited the WWI anthology To End All Wars.
Mal Jones is an Alexandria, VA based illustrator and designer. Recently he appeared with Marc Bryant in Off-Registration #4, available now for free!
A veteran writer and narrative designer for both Ubisoft and Microsoft, Charles Webb now contributes to Nerdist and is the managing editor for FreakSugar.com.
Kathryn Frizzell has worked on Absentee by Inverse Press and The Kill Joy Club by Icarus Wing Productions.
Lori Lapomardo COMING SOON!
John Audrey Portilla is a Colombian comic book artist. He has worked as an illustrator designing characters and developing illustrated children’s material for Colombian publishers, also has worked for Heroic Tendencies Studios and for MTG Publishing from Spain.
Russell Hossain COMING SOON!
Amberin Huq is a freelance illustrator who lives and works in London U.K, she regularly illustrates for Stew magazine and has most recently created work for the children’s theatre production ‘When Spring Comes’.
Ricky-Marcel Pitcher is a London based comics writer, currently working on his martial arts-horror-adventure epic 'Zombies Hate Kung Fu', check out www.VeryGraphicNovels.com for more info.

THE TEAM
Alt Control Delete is a collaboration between writer Ramón Govea, DC/Wildstorm & Lion Forge Comics artist Eddie Nuñez, & the incredibly talented colorist Ander Zárate, who has painted for Marvel, DC Comics, and BOOM! Studios among others.
THE STORY
Set in a futuristic world where video games have evolved into a virtual reality professional sport. Technology and games permeate nearly every aspect of life in a culture that thrives on games and competition and a society where XP is currency. The prevalent philosophy of this society walks the border of trans-humanism: man and machine are beginning to merge, but not everyone is happy about it.
In Alt Control Delete: Collapse, rising star and professional gamer, Tess is in pursuit of her AWOL friend. When Tess's secret investigation leads her deep into the gaming underbelly of New Angeles, she is faced with a choice: risk her tournament standings and follow her friend's trail or return to the safety of the compound and forget what she's seen.
We are seeking $10,000 USD to finish the 24-page first issue. The script is finished, and Eddie and Ander are already working on the rest of the pages for Issue #1. All of the funds raised here will go toward the art & printing of the book, fulfilling perks, marketing, and kicking transaction fees back to Kickstarter and Amazon.  
As soon as the book is finished we pitch to publishers and submit to Comixology, the largest self-publishing platform for digital comics.

$5,200—Finish the First Issue

The rest goes to right to Marketing, including Promotional Art & 2015 Convention Booths)

Artists including Vamp's awesome illustrator Neil Reed (plus one or two others we have waiting in the wings for future projects)
A huddle of programmers working in a closet to put together the apps and ebooks
And also a sound guy, because comics are way cooler with a soundtrack.
Plus, y'know. Us. We do the boring stuff.
We work in a wee studio in Sydney, Australia. It's nice here. Sometimes there is free chocolate. If this Kickstarter doesn't get funded, probably there will be less chocolate but THAT IS NOT GOING TO STOP US FROM MAKING COMICS. (Please help us get this Kickstarter funded.)
Where's the money going? That’s the thirty thousand dollar question.
We were lucky enough to be able to create Vamp off the skin of our backs, but in order to bring Revamped to life, we need a little help from our friends.

Before we do anything, there’s the 5% fee to Kickstarter. THEN there’s another 5% processing fee since we’re not a US-based project. (Boo.) This automatically cuts $3K from our budget.
And so: $27K. With some of that, we’re hoping to print both softcover and hardcover copies of Vamp. Setting and printing them locally, we expect that to take up around $9K of our budget.
Then, we’ve also got to sort out the art prints – again, with local printers (to save on shipping from them to us, and because BUYING LOCAL IS RAD) we’ve put aside $1100 there. Them’s gonna be some REAL NICE ARTS.

There will be some handling and packaging costs, but because we love you kids so much? We’ll probably just sort that out ourselves. Those guys who put in extra for shipping outside Australia are the best – it can get spendy to ship things outside of our big old island.
Okay! We’re down to like $17K, and we haven’t even started Revamped yet!
With the remaining funds, we’ve got to illustrate all 88 pages of Revamped. Then (as with Vamp) we’re converting it to both app and ebook, so we need to pay our programmers for that one. We’re also doing another spooky soundtrack available for app readers, and our awesome audio guy needs to be reimbursed for the hours he spends locked in a soundproof box.
That should cover it.

And if we get even more??? WE WILL SEND YOU ALL SO MUCH LOVE.

To begin, our stretch goals will involve sending cool stickers and postcards to our physical reward backers, but above $40K we’ll have to come up with some bonuses for everyone! Oooh, the creative cogs are a-turnin’...
Any more questions? No? Yes? I mean, you can hit us up via a KS message if you like! Anything for you guys.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Everything is a risk, man. Getting out of bed in the morning is a risk (and a challenge - it's Winter here).

No but seriously. If we aren't backed... no Revamped for us. No silky smooth papery Vamp copies to snuggle with on those cold nights. We'll still have other comics in future, but... sigh.

The risks to you guys are pretty minor - we're getting everything printed locally, so the only challenge will be dealing with Australia Post and its international compatriots. Sometimes stuff goes missing. But it's okay, we've built in enough of an overage so if things do get pear-shaped, we'll have backups for you. All good! It's all great. We'll be fantastic. We'll make a great team, you and us. Go team.

campaign.story:
HAIL TO THE KING, BABY
2014 marks the sixtieth anniversary of Godzilla, the world's most famous movie monster. Around the globe, people are celebrating this momentous occasion in many different ways, but no one honors Godzilla better than his homeland of Japan. The Big Godzilla Special Effects Exhibition will display original props, suits, production art and memorabilia in one centralized location - and it's only on display in Tokyo for two weeks. 
Exhibits like these are rarely seen by westerners and only a small fraction of the English speaking world has ventured to the land of the rising sun to view them. They return home with tales and photos of movie history and have had them published in fan magazines and on websites for decades. But with recent advances in technology, we can now share these stories and images in beautiful high definition.
Previous displays of Godzilla props in Japan
If successfully funded, Kyle Yount, the host of the Kaijucast will travel to Japan to document the Big Godzilla Special Effects Exhibition and interview key members from Godzilla's sixty-year history. The images and footage collected will be edited into a feature length documentary that will be available on YouTube titled Hail to the King: 60 Years of Destruction. If we meet some stretch goals, this documentary could eventually be available through Video On Demand services.
THE TEAM
Kyle has assembled a fantastic team to manage the campaign and get the ball rolling here in Portland. The campaign will be managed by Mikhail Hamilton, an amazing event coordinator who will keep our deliverables on track and everything in check both during the campaign and after it is successfully funded. Assisting in communication with our contacts in Japan will be our interpreter, Naoko Horikawa. Without a native Japanese speaker here on our team, correspondence with our friends in Tokyo would be next to impossible in such a short timeframe. We also have an awesome group of artists and fans who are helping to create some of the incredible perks for the campaign. Seriously, check out those rewards to the right!
TOKYO BOUND
Once in Japan, Kyle will meet up with another talented group. In addition to being fans of the kaiju genre, Jim Ballard and JR Lipartito operate ACTV Japan and will be capturing the experience and interviews during the four-day visit. Their shooting style and eye for detail will provide the documentary with a cinematic level of professionalism. Their experiences in shooting SciFi Japan TV will be key. Definitely check out the video below to see the skills they will bring to our documentary.
BACK IN THE USA
After the journey, Kyle will return to Portland and connect with long-time friend and supporter of the podcast, Martin Vavra. Martin runs Galaxy Sailor Productions, a Portland-based video production company. Together, they will begin the arduous process of transforming this raw footage into the feature-length documentary. The target date of completion is November 3rd, Godzilla’s birthday and the sixtieth anniversary of Gojira's 1954 debut.
MONEY TRAIL
How does your donation help make this project a reality? The $8,000 goal covers Kyle's flight to Japan and room & board in Tokyo, compensation for our filmmakers (who are pretty much doing this for a song), creating the backer rewards and the fees involved with a fully funded Kickstarter campaign. Without reaching this modest goal, the project cannot become a reality.
STRETCH GOALS! [Updated 07.29.2014]
Thankfully the project is fully funded! Now, as mentioned previously we do have stretch goals! 
STRETCH GOAL #1 RAISE $9,500 - ACHIEVED!!!
Our first bonus level for this project was to hire the camera crew for one more day of filming. Obviously, this means we are bringing back approximately 50% MORE footage for the documentary. We have some really great shots we want to get and interviews that we want to film. Which brings us to....
 STRETCH GOAL #2 RAISE $13,000 - ACHIEVED!!!
With this goal, we get a fantastic opportunity to reach out to the familiar faces to Godzilla fans, actors. The details are a little blurry right now, but with this funding we have a chance to speak to key cast members more than we did before. 
STRETCH GOAL #3 RAISE $17,000 - ACHIEVED!!!
It's not only a lofty goal but it's also a big stretch, but I want to emphasize the importance of this goal. I am by no means a skilled photographer. Hitting this mark allows me to bring a photographer along, my friend and lifelong kaiju fan, David Eric Dopko. Recently David was taking photos at G-FEST XXI and I was very impressed with his skills. David will also be documenting the documentary by taking stills and assisting me with the additional video that must be shot outside of our time with the camera crew.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Time is of the essence! Without a doubt, our biggest challenge is the ticking clock of funding this project, traveling to Tokyo and documenting this exhibit in a very short timeframe. If we meet our goal, we will only have four days in Japan to capture this monumental opportunity. 

Additionally, time also comes into play once the team assembles back in America. With less than three months to create the documentary, Martin and Kyle have their work cut out for them but they are excited to have the opportunity to work together.

Of course other challenges exist - the team will need to keep backers updated and coordinate with the creative collaborators to make sure the backers get their perks on time for donating. But while the entire team is fully committed to making this project a reality, only your donation can get this documentary off the ground. Please help us celebrate Godzilla's legacy by contributing to this independent documentary and thrilling kaiju fans around the world.

STRETCH GOALS & ADD-ONS
*****************************************************************************************
Stretch Goal #1
If we hit $7000 -- Everyone at the $13 pledge level and above will receive a beautiful 8.5x11 print of THE PROJECTIONIST Cover signed by artists David Daza and David Cobos.
Stretch Goal #2
If we hit $8200 -- We will extend the 1st issue of THE PROJECTIONIST from its currently planned 22 full-color pages to 28 full-color pages.
Add-On #1
EXTRA COPY of THE PROJECTIONIST issue 1 -- Add $13 to your pledge (+ $15 for international shipping)

Add-On #1
17x22 GICLEE PRINT of your choice of the Ethan Plane Pin-up or the THE PROJECTIONIST Cover -- Add $100 to your pledge (+ $85 for international shipping)
*****************************************************************************************
Hello, everyone. Thanks for stopping by! My name is Sam Midwood and I was born in a funeral parlor in Brooklyn. Now, let me tell you why we’re here…

I’ve written a mini-series called THE PROJECTIONIST and I need your help, your generosity of spirit, to breathe life into issue #1. That’s 24-pages of supernatural detectives, tough-as-nails cops, poltergeists, clairvoyants, goo-guns, and shadowy corporations. Oh! There’s also a dog named Ivan (after Ivan Reitman director of Ghostbusters) who... well… OK, I won’t spoil my favorite bit in the book for you. But, I will tell you a little more about...
THE PROJECTIONIST takes place in a world where ghosts exist and everyone knows it, in a society that polices its dead. Our central character is private detective Ethan Plane -- Ethan has the ability to ASTRAL PROJECT. While traveling outside of his body, Ethan is mistaken for a fugitive spirit and forced to go on the run from paranormal cops. If captured, Ethan will be doomed to suffer an eternity in some hellish afterlife.
WTF is ASTRAL PROJECTION?!
ASTRAL PROJECTION is the art of traveling outside of one's physical body. You've heard of people having out-of-body experiences? Astral projection is having an out-of-body experience, but, on purpose.
ETHAN PLANE Pin-Up
WTF is NECROPUNK?! 
NECROPUNK is the aesthetic. It is a world saturated in death. A society drunk on formaldehyde. The Dead are creeping into The Land of the Living and, little by little, eating it away. Buildings are decaying, subway tracks are rotting, the faint whiff of ether fills the air.
WITH THIS KICKSTARTER we will be producing the first 22-page issue of THE PROJECTIONIST six part mini-series in digital and print formats. The script is all ready for art, we've got a good price on a small but quality print-run, and we are beyond excited to get this first book out to you fine souls.
THE TEAM
DAVID DAZA (Pencils/Inks)
Pencils & Inks -- David Daza. David is a machine. Aside from banging out 22-pages in under 48 hours for the Reddit 48-Hour Comic Challenge, David's credits include STAR WARS: The OLD REPUBLIC (Dark Horse), TRANSFORMERS (IDW Publishing),  and Buckaroo Banzai (Moonstone). Collaborating with David is pure joy. He knows what I'm looking for even before I do. I could not ask for a better artist to ride this ghost train with. Check him out right here.
MARTA MARTINEZ (Colors)
Colors -- Marta Martinez. Marta is, pardon my French, a bad-ass. She has colored BATMAN, SUPERMAN, IRON MAN, CAPTAIN AMERICA, WONDER WOMAN, WOLVERINE, ad infinitum.  Marta is a genius.You give Marta a couple of notes and she comes back with a masterpiece. She's also in a rock band.Check her out right here.
SAM MIDWOOD (Words)
Words -- Sam Midwood. What can I say about Sam that hasn't already been said by Sam himself?! While Sam is no stranger to writing -- he wrote his first play when he was nineteen and produced it in big bad New York City -- this is his first, but most certainly not his last, comic book. He also LOVES to talk about himself in the third-person.
PAGE 2 of "THE PROJECTIONIST"
THE MONEY
Where does the money go? It goes primarily to the artists -- David and Marta. I don't take a penny. Each page costs roughly $220 to produce, which is relatively cheap considering the level of talent we have.The rest will go to cover the cost of a small print run, backer rewards, and shipping.
How to a make a pledge? Simply click the green BACK THIS PROJECT button. You will be asked to enter your pledge amount and select a reward tier. You will then go through the Amazon checkout process.
FAQ
What if I have other questions? See the KICKSTARTER Frequently Asked Questions right here.

David and Marta, besides being veterans of the comic book industry, are consummate professionals. Also... I think they might be vampires. campaign.story:
"It doesn't matter where you're going,
        It doesn't matter where you've been,
                     All that matters is now,"
You've read the full format graphic novel, now get ready for the regular series.
Featuring Marvel & Valiant cover artist Jeff Dekal, interior art from Jose Varese (Creature Entertainment) and Pat Broderick (Captain Marvel, Batman:Year 3) along with pinups from Paolo Pantalena and Dragonfish.
HooligansCo proudly presents....................
FARO 2 Cover by Jeff Dekal
The Chronicles of FARO -- Chapter 1 introduced us to Professor Francis Kane, who destroys his life and reputation when he attempts to travel back in time to prevent the Assassination of Abraham Lincoln.
Arriving just as John Wilkes Booth is making his fateful entrance into Ford's Theater, the Professor is unprepared for the journey and ends up in an altercation that leads to him being locked up in an insane asylum.  Rotting to death with no one believing his story, he is rescued by what appears to be a guardian angel.
Traveling back to the beginning of time, Professor Kane becomes THE FARO, and takes over the world as its ultimate warlord, until he is destroyed by The Wrath of GOD.  
After his supposed "Death" Faro wakes up in a New York City brothel on the eve of the Civil War, where he appears to look 20 years younger.  The guests in the brothel on that fateful night, a young and brash John Wilkes Booth and a then Presidential hopeful Abraham Lincoln.  
FARO starts out as a time travel story, slowly morphs into a wild and erotic love story before culminating in the ultimate tale of redemption.
There are a lot of indie comics to choose from, that's why I wanted to really explode onto the market by doing FARO 1 in a graphic novel format.  Using 26 artists across 5 continents, it took 7 months from the day we were funded till we had a beautiful bouncing baby book.
The small success of FARO has gotten me into the ranks of the Miami based monsters at CREATURE ENTERTAINMENT which has lent me the talents of two of their top mercenaries, Jeff Dekal, who will be doing the cover, and Jose Varese, who will be drawing the very dark and disturbing scene -- The Origin of Domina Palms
Interior sketches from Jose Varese
The Ravenous Jose Varese will also be drawing the poster for FARO -- Chapter 3.  
As a special limited reward,  Jose Varese & Pat Broderick will be doing BLANK COVER COMMISSIONS, either for a FARO blank or any superhero blank of your choice. 
We hope this is the first of many FARO CREATURE FEATURES.
SOLD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!-- Now go design your own commission and immortalize your vision
Drawing the second half of FARO 2 is Tampa's silent warlock, the great Pat Broderick, who kicked some natural ass as one of the all star artists on FARO -- Chapter 1.
After a look into a dark fate for New York, Pat's scene takes you to post-Civil War New Orleans, where a new game is proposed that has Abraham Lincoln captured and Congress wiped out in an attempt to take over the Gulf of Mexico.
Paolo Pantalena Original Art Available
The only hope for Lincoln's New America lie in those still loyal to his cause, who must uncover the connection between the French Emperor, the KKK Militia, and The Circle, the elite group of trillionaire time travelers who've been stranded in the aftermath of FARO 1.
FARO, as always is aided by his friend & sidekick, MUZIO the MAULER, as well as a new addition to the crew, Rachel Rain -- the Ace of Blades.
With the campaign for Chapter 2 officially underway, we are proud to announce that Chapters 3,4 & 5 are already in pre-production, so the future of Faro is bright.
Remember, this isn't just a story, it's a ride through an immortal's insanity
Thanks for being a part of our world and we hope you enjoy reading Faro as much we enjoy making it.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge to FARO 1 was coordinating so many artists schedules and making sure the right pages went to the right colorists and letterers. We had 26 artists of varying levels of drama, deadlines and death defying diatribes. This time we have a team of 8 and I'm happy to report the main creative team is based in South Florida. After a year in the trenches, and now with my mentors at Creature Entertainment, I have learned so much that I can't wait to apply to this campaign.

campaign.story:
Fan response has been overwhelming for Rick's self-published projects and we hope this one will be no different.  As a resident of Lincoln County, Rick is excited to bring the first ever true account of the death of Billy the Kid to a published graphic novel format.  It is a 8 x 10", 60 page black and white hardcover graphic novel, slightly longer in page count and larger in size than Rick's previously published 'Elwell Enigma'.  You can tell from the art pictured that Rick has another hit on his hands.
Funds raised with this campaign will go toward publication and shipping expenses associated with this book. Rick is a veteran of the comic and publishing industry for more than 35 years. His previous works continue to be strong sellers as he has been nominated for and won numerous industry awards, including a 2014 nomination for his latest graphic novel, 'The Madison Square Tragedy", published by NBM. 
Cover art for the graphic novel.
